JPMorgan Downgrades $GS to Neutral from Overweight, Raises PT to $750 from $625

Analyst comments: "We see Goldman Sachs shares as fairly valued now. GS has demonstrated strong market share improvement in its Sales and Trading business over the last few years and the franchise has been refocused on its strengths in Global Banking and Markets as well as Asset and Wealth Management. Platform Solutions, which was a topic of much debate for a while, is now mainly the Apple Card and Transaction Banking business with limited contribution (JPMe 5% in 2025E) to Group Revenues.

We also acknowledge the more durable nature of the revenue streams in Investment Banks, something which we had highlighted 5 years back in our report 'Global Investment Banks: The Future of Investment Banking.' However, in a global context, we continue to prefer European IBs Barclays and DBK at significantly cheaper valuations, while for Wealth Management gearing we prefer UBS over MS. We continue with our preference for GS over MS in the U.S."

Analyst: Kian Abouhossein
TweetShift

BofA Earnings Preview for $META (PT $900):

"We expect 3Q revenue/EPS of $50.0bn/$7.30 vs Street $49.5bn/$6.69. Checks suggest potential upside driven by improving macro, accelerating AI benefits, and higher sector ad spend to backfill softer organic Google traffic. We think Street could be expecting 3Q revenue between $50.5â€“51.0bn. Job data suggests investment continues with 3Q postings up 6% q/q; we estimate 3Q operating margins down 49bps y/y to 42.3%.

For 4Qâ€™25, we estimate revenue/EPS of $58.8bn/$8.90 vs Street $57.3bn/$8.12. Assuming 3Q comes in at the high end of guidance, we expect 4Q guidance of $55.5â€“59bn (up 15â€“22% y/y). Given AI build, we expect continued FY25 investments and think Meta could narrow its CYâ€™25 expense range to $115â€“117bn (from $114â€“118bn) and raise the low end of Capex range by $2bn to guide to $68â€“72bn. We expect Meta to formally guide 2026 expenses on the next call while maintaining the outlook for 2026 expense growth to accelerate (higher D&A)."

Analyst: Justin Post

$IONQ achieved a new world record with 99.99% two-qubit gate fidelity, the highest ever reported. The milestone, reached using its Electronic Qubit Control tech, surpasses the prior 99.97% record from Oxford Ionics (now part of IonQ) and marks a key step toward scalable fault-tolerant quantum systems by 2030.

[21/10/2025 11:40] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift


{Embed}
Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§
https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1980554559547392446
Tweeted
KeyBanc Initiates Coverage on $HIMS with Sector Weight Rating

Analyst comments: "Hims & Hers is a disruptive direct-to-consumer healthcare business with 2.4 million subscribers as of 2Q25. Hims focuses on personalized care to help customers achieve results, with approximately 1.5 million subscribers on personalized plans. We believe a combination of new treatment launches and international expansion gives Hims ample runway for growth over the coming years.

Investment positives:

1. Established brand;
2. Clear product and geographic expansion opportunities;
3. High gross margin;
4. Feedback loops between treatment and outcomes could create a data and product advantage over time.

Investment negatives:

1. The industry is intensely competitive;
2. Lapping GLP-1 shortages creates tough comps through 1Q26;
3. Both compounding and healthcare marketing practices are subject to intense regulatory scrutiny;
4. Limited history operating in international markets.

Estimates: We project 2025E, 2026E, and 2027E revenue of $2.35B, $2.78B, and $3.34B, respectively. In turn, we project EBITDA of $309M, $390M, and $505M. Given management's focus on delivering more value to subscribers, we expect the company to optimize for subscriber and revenue growth over the coming years while allowing for gradual EBITDA margin expansion."

Analyst: Justin Patterson

Morgan Stanley Reiterates Overweight Rating on $SPOT, PT $800

Analyst comments: "Having added significant value to its free and Premium tiers, Spotify in our view kicked off a new pricing cycle this Fall and is poised to accelerate growth into next year. We also see AI as a tailwind and move SPOT to Top Pick in Media & Entertainment. We see revenue growth accelerating, upside to consensus EBIT, and are optimistic Spotify can leverage AI into tangible financial benefits in the years ahead.

Spotify continues to add new features and functionality to its Premium tier, and we expect it to follow with a pricing cycle in 2026 that already began in September. Spotifyâ€™s recent 14â€“17% price increases in Australia, in our view, create a template for other bundled markets in 2026, and we expect a U.S. price increase by 1Q26. The recent improvement to its free tierâ€”which includes an hour of on-demand listeningâ€”is meaningful and can drive upside to MAU and Premium net adds.

Lowering 4Q25: Price increases announced to date suggest roughly 2% ex-FX ARPU growth in 4Q, lower than prior estimates. We remain in-line with consensus 4Q gross margins."

Analyst: Benjamin Swinburne

TD Cowen Downgrades $TEM to Hold from Buy, Raises PT to $88 from $72

Analyst comments: "We are downgrading TEM to Hold as we see the stock more fairly valued following the strong performance (+38% since 9/30 and +160% year-to-date). TEMâ€™s EV/Sales multiple expanded from approximately 7x (at 2Q) to around 11x today despite little fundamental change. Oncology diagnostics peers have also seen strong returns and multiple expansion, though TEM stands out. We raise our price target to $88 from $72, applying an approximately 8x forward EV/Sales multiple."

Analyst: Dan Brennan

Tweeted
CenterPoint Energy $CNP will sell its Ohio natural gas distribution business to National Fuel Gas $NFG for $2.62B.

The deal includes Vectren Energy Delivery of Ohio, which serves 335,000 customers with 5,900 miles of pipeline. CenterPoint expects to close in Q4 2026, receiving $1.42B in 2026 and $1.2B in 2027 via a seller note.

CenterPoint said proceeds will support its $65B capital plan and maintain its 9% EPS growth target. Goldman Sachs and Guggenheim advised on the deal.

Wells Fargo Raises $BE PT to $95 from $65 - EW

Analyst comments: "While weâ€™re believers in the behind-the-meter (BTM) market and expect BE to win most fuel-cell orders, the rapid increase in the stock price now reflects shipments well beyond our estimate of the fuel-cell TAM for BTM (~5 GW). BE will need to follow through with significant firm orders to justify the current stock price, introducing downside risk if these announcements do not materialize.

On the flip side, itâ€™s possible weâ€™ve underestimated the BTM TAMâ€”BE could continue to announce additional strategic relationships which could lead to firm orders, potentially further propelling shares. At this juncture, BE is trading on positive momentum as the company has demonstrated a genuine demand for its product for BTM solutions. While we expect a pullback or re-calibration in the share price, the catalyst and timing are less certain. Thus, we remain Equal Weight as we assess what level of firm orders will materialize."

Analyst: Michael Blum

Tweeted
Guggenheim Reiterates Sell Rating on $NET, PT $111

Analyst comments: "We expect Cloudflare to exceed 3Q consensus revenue, but with potentially less upside than the 1H25 beats, and raise FY25 revenue guidance again. Cloudflareâ€™s business momentum has improved over the last two quarters as new ARR growth has accelerated off easy comps. We donâ€™t think the better-than-expected 1H momentum is a factor of an improved IT spending environment, but rather that Cloudflare has expanded its product portfolio capabilities, and CEO/Co-Founder Matthew Prince has brought in talented, well-respected executives.

We believe the hiring and leadership of Mark Anderson as President of Revenue and CJ Desai as Head of Product are beginning to bear fruit, though there is still more work to be done. Cloudflare has been focused on building out a channel presence under the leadership of Tom Evans, a former channel head at PANW. Our field checks this quarter are similar to prior periodsâ€”some partners have had success with Cloudflare while others havenâ€™t. Either way, we believe the channel will become a larger percentage of the business over time (vs. 25% in 2Q25).

All that said, Cloudflare continues to innovate and take the right steps, but the premium valuation prices NET shares for perfection (or beyond) and introduces significant risk, in our view. At 32.5x EV/NTM recurring revenue, NET is the most expensive name in our coverage universe and one of the most expensive stocks across broader software. We remain Sell-rated heading into the earnings print, despite what appears to be a relatively favorable numerical setup. Cloudflare reports 3Q25 earnings on Thursday, October 30, after market close."

Analyst: John DiFucci

Tweeted
Iridium $IRDM won a U.S. Department of Transportation contract to deploy its positioning, navigation, and timing (PNT) services in partnership with T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS).

Under the program, T-Mobile will install Iridium PNT receivers at 90 additional 5G sites nationwide to provide backup timing synchronization and protect against GPS disruptions.

Iridium says its signals offer sub-100-nanosecond accuracy, are 1,000Ã— stronger than GPS, and can work indoors without external antennas, enhancing 5G network resilience and security.

Tweeted
Viking Therapeutics $VKTX began a Phase 1 maintenance-dosing trial for its obesity drug VK2735 after initial weight-loss success.

The study will test monthly subcutaneous, weekly oral, and daily oral regimens in ~180 adults to assess safety, tolerability, and sustained weight-loss effects.

Results expected in 2026; ongoing Phase 3 VANQUISH-1 & 2 studies continue testing weekly subQ VK2735 across ~5,600 participants.

Cantor Fitzgerald Initiates Coverage on $SMR with Overweight Rating, PT $55

Analyst comments: "NuScale is the only company with NRC approval for its small modular reactor (SMR) designs, which is backed by hundreds of years of safe operating history. With a clear head start, NuScale has now shifted focus toward securing a multi-gigawatt supply of module production to fulfill its approximately 78-module demand funnel. We believe NuScale will be a big winner during the coming multi-trillion-dollar energy transition. We are initiating coverage with an Overweight rating and a 12-month price target of $55."

Analyst: Derek Soderberg

The plans include $0 copays for in-network mental health visits (virtual and in-person), Part B giveback, and $0 premiums. Coverage extends to dental, vision, and hearing.

Available in 46 states + D.C., the plans aim to improve access to civilian providers for aging veterans, with results from the Annual Election Period (Oct 15â€“Dec 7).

Philip Morris International raised its 2025 EPS forecast to $7.46â€“$7.56 adjusted, up from prior guidance of $7.43â€“$7.56, driven by continued strength in smokeless tobacco products.

[21/10/2025 15:45] amit â€¢ TweetShift
$NVDA $AMD $AVGO $ORCL $GOOGL

THE WSJ PUBLISHED A MAJOR STORY LAST NIGHT.

At the core of it, they are reporting that the $100B Nvidia-OpenAI deal came as a result of Sam Altman making Jensen feel that OpenAI was exploring other options.

Remember when The Information reported that OpenAI was thinking of using Google's TPUs? 

A few days later, Nvidia's X account posts a screenshot of a Reuters article denying that OpenAI was going to be using Google?

All of this seemed calculated from Sam to get Jensen to the table to make that $100B investment in them and further intertwine OpenAI's success to Nvidia's success. 

After the deal was made, Sam went on to get deals with $AVGO and $AMD...really making sure he could diversify as much as possible while bringing more companies and their progress into OpenAI's trajectory.

The punchline being...Altman is ruthlessly trying to make sure that if AI ends up being the transformational technology we all think it can become...he is going to be at the center of it.

Essentially, he's trying to make OpenAI too big to fail by making sure that every other important AI company fails if OpenAI does.

Absolutely crazy time to witness this happening in front of us.
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1980616285462388889)

{Embed}
amit (@amitisinvesting) âœ§
https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1980616285462388889

All of this seemed calculated from Sam to get Jensen to the table to make that $100B investment in them and further intertwine OpenAI's success to Nvidia's success. 

After the deal was made, Sam went on to get deals with $AVGO and $AMD...really making sure he could diversify as much as possible while bringing more companies and their progress into OpenAI's trajectory.

The punchline being...Altman is ruthlessly trying to make sure that if AI ends up being the transformational technology we all think it can become...he is going to be at the center of it.

$WBD REVIEWING STRATEGIC OPTIONS

Warner Bros. Discovery said its board has begun a review of strategic alternatives after receiving unsolicited takeover interest for the whole company and its Warner Bros division.

Options on the table include a full sale, separate deals for Warner Bros and Discovery Global, or the planned mid-2026 split into two companies.

CEO David Zaslav said the review aims to â€œunlock full asset value.â€ No timeline was given for a decision.

[21/10/2025 19:34] amit â€¢ TweetShift
$GRAB

Grab price action is a classic example of manipulation/shorts being in control.

The stock was $6+ for a month, had the highest volume ever in September (1B), and now gets stuck in the $5.50s. This is likely due to the short float now going up above 8% and being stuck to the whim of these algos.

The only way to break though...strong earnings. I expect Q3 to be very strong, along with Maybank that has 3-5% higher targets across the board on Grab, but nonetheless price action is of course frustating.

Important to remember the facts during these situations:

- stock is up 20% YTD, beating the S&P

- smart money is loading the boat, 84% of the float is institutional and only increase

- if you are in this long, these are moment to further add vs get scared because some random hype name is going up (as we can see lately, those names are violently losing 20% in a week)

- mgmt has done 7-8 NEW interviews in the last month, first time in over 3 years they are engaging with the media, that is not bearish

- this company, unlike many of the names up 5-8x YTD that are now seeing weakness, has 7B in cash. i will take poor performance being able to sleep at night knowing my company has a massive balance sheet over getting into speculation that has narrative powering it, not a balance sheet

- rates coming down will give a premium to companies that can actually grow

- product innovation is high, multiple new partnerships every month, broadening of their scale across financial services (will do 1B in loans by end of year) and GAAP profitable

Not something to be scared about but rather understand the manipulation is inevitable until a re-rating and if the tutes continue to buy, they also are expecting a change in growth expectations as well.
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1980674015040598265)

{Embed}

https://twitter.com/PalantirTech/status/1980680045937979447
The Noto Peninsula earthquake in January 2024 scattered over 62,000 evacuees across prefectures. Palantir engineers built "Victim 360", unifying 15 fragmented data sources representing 120,000 citizens in the region, enabling evacuees to be found and supported. When flooding struck months later, the same system was redeployed in just 24 hours.

i am very curious to see if this trade just got overcrowded and needed a breather or if there is some serious selling happening by central banks to either take profits or get back into bondsâ€¦

Draftking $DKNG is acquiring predictions platform Railbird, which is licensed by the CFTC to operate an event contracts exchange, per CNBC.

The deal will power DraftKingsâ€™ upcoming â€œDraftKings Predictionsâ€ platform, letting users trade outcomes on events in finance, culture, and entertainment, expanding beyond sports betting.

CEO Jason Robins said prediction markets could be a â€œnew opportunityâ€ for the business, combining Railbirdâ€™s tech with DraftKingsâ€™ scale and mobile expertise. 

The launch is expected in the coming months, focusing on non-sports betting states like California and Texas to avoid regulatory overlap.

Companies like $OKLO (backed by Sam Altman) and Franceâ€™s Newcleo are expected to apply. The move follows Trumpâ€™s executive orders to boost nuclear energy and unlock surplus fuel for SMR developers.

[22/10/2025 1:28] Evan â€¢ TweetShift
Meta Platforms $META announced today that it formed a joint venture with Blue Owl Capital in a deal worth $27 billion to fund and develop Meta's Hyperion data center in rural Louisiana

As part of the deal, the asset management firm will own 80% of the joint venture, while Meta will retain a 20% stake and oversee the construction and property management services of the data center

Blue Owl contributed about $7 billion in cash as part of the joint venture, while Meta received a one-time payout of $3 billion

(Source CNBC)

The Trump administration is preparing a Section 301 trade investigation into whether U.S. trading partners are underpaying for prescription drugs, setting up potential new tariffs on medicines and related goods, per the Financial Times.

Trump has repeatedly argued other countries pay far less for drugs, citing examples like Ozempic, which costs $936/month in the U.S. vs $83 in France, and vowed to â€œequalizeâ€ prices. The probe could lead to broad new trade measures, reigniting tensions with allies in Europe, Canada, and Asia.

HEINEKEN CUTS 2025 GUIDANCE

Heineken lowered its full-year beer volume forecast and said earnings will come in at the low end of its prior range after weak consumer sentiment and trade uncertainty hit demand in the U.S. and other key markets, per WSJ.

Beer volumes fell 4.3% organically in Q3, with the sharpest declines in the U.S. and Brazil. Revenue came in at â‚¬8.71B, down 4% YoY, while adjusted net revenue slipped 0.3% to â‚¬7.33B.

The brewer now expects full-year volumes to decline and operating profit growth to land at the low end of its 4â€“8% guidance. Heineken cited inflation, currency pressure, and weak consumer confidence but said it expects demand to recover once conditions stabilize.
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1980909589895033154)

[22/10/2025 11:37] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Jaguar Land Rover experienced a major cyberattack in August that shut down its internal systems and halted production for nearly a month, an incident now estimated to have cost the UK around Â£1.9 billion, making it likely the countryâ€™s most economically damaging cyber event.

The attack disrupted operations across more than 5,000 British organizations connected to JLRâ€™s supply chain, prompting the UK government to step in with a Â£1.5 billion loan guarantee to support the carmaker and its partners. 

JLR, owned by Tata Motors, has only recently resumed partial production after the August 31 attack. Investigators believe the financial losses stem from halted vehicle sales, profit declines, recovery expenses, and supply chain effects.

The National Crime Agency is leading the investigation, though few details about the attackers have been released. 

Source: Financial Times

Baiduâ€™s $BIDU autonomous ride-hailing arm Apollo Go is partnering with Swiss Postâ€™s PostBus to launch Europeâ€™s 1ST commercial robotaxi service with vehicles that have no steering wheels. 

The new service will be called AmiGo and is scheduled to debut in eastern Switzerland, covering St. Gallen, Appenzell Ausserrhoden, and Appenzell Innerrhoden, with support from Swiss transport authorities.

Testing begins in December 2025 with safety drivers, expanding to select public use in early 2026, and fully driverless operations expected by Q1 2027. 

The service will use Baiduâ€™s Level 4 autonomous RT6 vehicles, which can seat four passengers and support ride-pooling to improve efficiency.

Google says it will be able to generate unique data for use with AI

"In the future, the Quantum Echoes algorithm may be able to help measure molecular structure in molecules which could aid in drug discovery and help material science through identifying new types of materials"

(Source Reuters)

Homebuyers are backing out at the highest rate in a year.

About 15% of U.S. home-purchase contracts were canceled in September, up from 13.6% last year, according to Redfin. 

Thatâ€™s roughly 53,000 deals that fell through, the biggest share since 2023.

Florida and Texas led the nation, with Tampa seeing 20% of contracts canceled as high prices, insurance costs, and inspection issues continue to spook buyers.

$GOOGL confirmed itâ€™s the developer behind a $1 Billion, 500-acre data center project in Morgan County, Indiana, ending speculation around the mysterious â€œProject Louie.â€

The Morgan County site, near Monrovia, will feature four data center buildings, powered by a 1,200 MW substation and using about 4M gallons of water daily, per utility filings.

Local officials approved 40-year tax breaks on computing equipment and a 10-year, 50% property tax abatement. 

The project will employ roughly 50 people per building and marks Googleâ€™s second major Indiana campus, alongside its $2B Fort Wayne facility.

[22/10/2025 23:19] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Moderna $MRNA said its phase 3 CMV vaccine trial failed to meet primary efficacy goals, with protection ranging from just 6â€“23% depending on criteria. 

The company will discontinue development of the CMV vaccine for congenital infection prevention.

The study included 7,500 women across 13 countries and showed a clean safety profile with no major concerns. Moderna will still test the vaccine in bone marrow transplant patients, where CMV reactivation poses risk.

CEO StÃ©phane Bancel called the outcome â€œdisappointing,â€ but noted the companyâ€™s 2025 guidance and 2028 breakeven target remain unchanged, as CMV wasnâ€™t expected to contribute meaningful near-term revenue.

[23/10/2025 1:00] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
$TSLA CEO ON OPTIMUS:

I don't want to downplay the difficulty of Optimus. It's an incredibly difficult thing, especially it's difficult to create a a hand that is as dexterous and capable as the human hand, which is an incredible. The human hand is an incredible thing that the more you study the human hand, the more incredible you realize.

To make a truly useful, generalized robot, you need that incredible hand, real-world AI, and the ability to scale production to car-like volumes,  even higher, ideally. Making just a few hundred robots isnâ€™t relevant.

The real challenge is manufacturing at that scale. Thereâ€™s no existing supply chain for humanoid robots. Unlike cars or computers, it simply doesnâ€™t exist. Tesla has to go deep into vertical integration and build many of the parts internally.â€
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1981118484064194746)

Elon Musk on the Upcoming Vote on Pay Package:

I want to take a moment to talk about an extremely important vote being held on November 6th. This meeting will shape the future of Tesla, and weâ€™re asking shareholders to support my leadership through the two compensation proposals and the re-election of Ira, Kathleen, and Joe to the board.

Tesla is a team sport, and the board is an essential part of that team. Shareholders are at the center of everything we do. The special committee has proposed what I wouldnâ€™t even call a compensation package, itâ€™s really about ensuring thereâ€™s enough voting control to have strong influence, but not so much that I couldnâ€™t be removed if I went insane.

Weâ€™ve explored every possible way to achieve increased voting control. Once a company is public, thereâ€™s no way to add super-voting stock. Companies like Google and Meta had it before going public, so it was grandfathered in. Tesla doesnâ€™t have that option.

I also want to address a major issue with corporate governance today. A large share of Tesla is owned by passive index funds that vote based on recommendations from Glass Lewis and ISS. These firms have made terrible recommendations in the past that would have been extremely damaging if followed.

If too much of a public company is controlled by index funds, itâ€™s effectively controlled by Glass Lewis and ISS. Thatâ€™s a fundamental problem because theyâ€™re not voting in the best interest of shareholders or the companyâ€™s long-term success.

OpenAI along with Oracle $ORCL and Vantage Data Centers will develop a data center campus named "Lighthouse" outside Milwaukee in Port Washington, Wisconsin

The companies said the "campus will feature four cutting-edge data centers providing close to a gigawatt of AI capacity"

Construction will begin soon and is scheduled for completion in 2028

The project expects to create more than 4,000 skilled construction jobs ... Once complete, Vantage and Oracle will create more than 1,000 long-term jobs and thousands more indirect jobs.

The companies said the projects will contribute and estimated $2.7 Billion to regional Gross Domestic Product (GDP).

The announcement is a part of the recently announced Stargate project

[23/10/2025 8:10] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
The Trump administration is in talks with quantum-computing firms to exchange federal funding for equity stakes, per WSJ.

Companies like $IONQ, $RGTI, $QBTS, and $QUBT are discussing government ownership stakes via the Commerce Department, with proposed minimum funding of $10 million each.

Deputy Commerce Secretary Paul Dabbar is leading the talks under a restructured CHIPS R&D Office.

Tesla supplier STMicroelectronics $STM reported Q3 revenue of $3.19B (-2% YoY; +15% QoQ), slightly above estimates, but net profit dropped to $237M from $351M as demand for auto and industrial chips remains weak.

The European chipmaker expects FY25 sales around $11.75B (vs $13.27B in 2024) and Q4 revenue near $3.28B, hinting a slower recovery in legacy chip markets despite strong AI-related demand.

STMicro also plans to cut capex to under $2B and continue 5,000 workforce reductions by 2027, adapting to tariffs and uneven global chip demand.

[23/10/2025 11:57] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
JPMorgan Upgrades $LC to Overweight from Neutral, Raises PT to $22 from $17

Analyst comments: "3Q25 originations and pre-provision net revenue (PPNR) came in comfortably ahead of JPMorgan and Street estimates, with return on tangible common equity (ROTCE) reaching approximately 13%, the highest level in three years, helped by a growing held-for-sale (HFS) portfolio, which generates solid day-one profitability and should ultimately lead to better loan sale economics over time.

Fundamentally, loan buyer demand remains strong as LC announced another $1 billion funding agreement with BlackRock, and increased marketing efforts are far from optimized but already bearing fruit, which is especially encouraging. Looking ahead, the company has more ways than ever to grow originations and profits without incurring punitive CECL charges, which should fuel accelerating profit growth and improved return metrics in 2026 and beyond.

As such, we are moving to Overweight from Neutral and increasing our Dec-26 PT to $22 from $17, and look to the Nov 5th Investor Day as the next positive catalyst."

Analyst: Reginald Smith
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1981283646859596185)

https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1981283646859596185

Intelâ€™s $INTC next-gen Panther Lake chips are showing real muscle in early benchmarks. 

The Core Ultra X7 358H, spotted on an Asus ROG Zephyrus G14, delivered a 25% graphics uplift versus Arrow Lake-H, hitting ~53K OpenCL points on Geekbench.

Built on Intelâ€™s new 18A process (with RibbonFET and PowerVia tech), Panther Lake marks Intelâ€™s first U.S.-made consumer chip from its Fab 52 in Arizona. Production is underway, with full launch slated for early 2026.

Intel says the architecture offers 50% faster CPU performance than Lunar Lake and 40% better efficiency than Arrow Lake, while integrated Xe3 graphics now rival Nvidiaâ€™s RTX 3050 Mobile, a big leap for Intelâ€™s iGPU game.

[23/10/2025 12:31] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Goldman Sachs Reiterates Buy Rating on $LRCX, PT $160

Analyst comments: "We expect the stock to be range bound following a quarter and guidance that were ahead of the Street. We believe investor expectations had increased heading into the call given AI-related datacenter announcements, solid peer reports from ASML and others, and strong price action.

We were encouraged by management's constructive commentary on 2026 wafer fab equipment (WFE), with growth expected across all segments, although we believe stock price action could be tempered by muted expectations around China and gross margin headwinds. We remain Buy rated as we believe Lam is positioned to outperform peers given its high relative exposure to deposition and etch, where intensity should increase, and its strong share of NAND equipment upgrades. As NAND suppliers focus on upgrading existing equipment, Lam will benefit disproportionately as that market recovers, supported by the company's leadership in high-bandwidth memory (HBM)."

[23/10/2025 12:33] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Barclays Reiterates Equalweight Rating on $TSLA, PT $350

Analyst comments: "While the Tesla call delivered few incremental updates on these topics, we were reminded of Elonâ€™s characterization of the inflection point ahead for Tesla as it doubles down on its mission of sustainable abundance driven by real-world AI. Tesla continues to work to fully validate the opportunities ahead for both Robotaxi and Optimus. We believe the path over the next year is ambitious, and we view the opportunity as a show-me story.

If Tesla can successfully remove the safety rider from its Robotaxi (guided in Austin by year-end) and demonstrate with Optimus V3 (forthcoming in 2026) that it is manufacturable and can improve productivity for owners, these could be key steps in validating the narrative.

As for the fundamentals, the auto gross margin miss was somewhat of a surprise, but we believe higher operating expenses will be overlooked. We were surprised to hear Elon discuss plans to increase production, especially given potential risks to demand following the expiration of the U.S. EV tax credit. We see volume rising only modestly next year, with margins likely to deteriorate year-over-year; our 2026 EPS estimate of $1.54 is significantly below consensus of $2.40. Yet we believe it is increasingly understood that this does not matter to investors."

Analyst: Dan Levy

[23/10/2025 12:34] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Mizuho Downgrades $ENPH to Neutral from Outperform, Lowers PT to $37 from $50

Analyst comments: "We downgrade Enphase to Neutral and reduce our price target by 26% to $37. Our downgrade reflects reduced residential solar demand in 2026, lower solar market share due to lease switching, limited visibility into the success of a new lease-plus-loan financing model for smaller installers, and limited cost declines from IQ9 technology adoption, which are confined to the commercial market.

Market share loss in 2026 is partially offset by safe harbor demand pull, which adds approximately $1 per share in net present value. We estimate over $200 million of safe harbor orders in mid-2026 for project completions in 2029â€“2030. We expect a Q3 beat due to safe harbor sales and a Q4 guidance miss versus consensus due to channel inventory slowing ahead of the tax credit step down."

Analyst: Maheep Mandloi

[23/10/2025 13:32] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
Jefferies analyst Jeff Kim cautious on $MU Micronâ€™s HBM4 roadmap, keeping Samsung as his top pick in the memory sector and ranking SK Hynix #2.

He said Micron may be â€œlate to the HBM4 partyâ€, noting engineering sources indicate the company must redesign its metal layer and wiring to achieve meaningful volume at 11 Gbps. 

He believes that process could take 6 to 9 months, limiting Micronâ€™s near-term output and forcing some 2026 capacity toward server DRAM instead.

He also warned that Micronâ€™s current HBM4 yield and volume remain weak, despite managementâ€™s claims of 11 Gbps performance on its latest call. He expects HBM4 prices to rise as supply tightens and Micronâ€™s redesign delays constrain capacity.

Overall, Jefferies views Samsung as best positioned to capture HBM4 share at scale, while Micron might face execution risk and may cede early-cycle advantage to Samsung and SK Hynix.

$PLUG Power said it deployed hydrogen fuel cell systems at Floor & Decorâ€™s distribution center in Frederickson, Washington. The setup powers 77 pieces of equipment, marking the retailerâ€™s first zero-emission material handling fleet.

The system includes a 10,000-gallon liquid hydrogen tank, vaporizers, compressors, and a high-capacity dispenser, eliminating over 400 metric tons of COâ‚‚ annually, equal to avoiding about 45,000 gallons of gasoline. The installation also captures and reuses around 300 liters of water per day for facility operations.

The Pentagon has funded a joint development effort between NioCorp $NB and Lockheed Martinâ€™s Skunk Works division to create a scandium-based defense technology. 

The program, backed by the Department of War under a $10 million Defense Production Act Title III award, will focus on producing aluminum-scandium alloy components for next-generation fighter aircraft.

NioCorp CEO Mark Smith said the partnership will help establish a domestic scandium supply chain through the companyâ€™s Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project in Nebraska, which aims to produce about 100 tonnes of scandium oxide per year. 

Lockheed Martin said the initiative connects U.S. critical mineral mining to advanced materials for national defense applications.

The project, dubbed Project Helios, will integrate a 20â€“25 MW arc jet and a 200 kW fiber laser for testing thermal protection systems on hypersonic vehicles â€” filling critical U.S. testing infrastructure gaps.

CEO Eric DeMarco said the facility will â€œadvance hypersonic technology development while alleviating the current testing bottleneck.â€ Kratos SRE, with 80 years of high-temp materials expertise, will partner with North Wind and New Horizon 5 for design.

The company expects the facility to boost testing throughput and cut program costs, supporting all branches of the U.S. Armed Forces.

Google $GOOGL signed its first deal to buy power from a U.S. natural gas plant equipped with carbon capture, aimed at supplying its Midwest data centers. 

The 400-megawatt facility in Decatur, Illinois, will be developed by Low Carbon Infrastructure and is expected to trap about 90% of its COâ‚‚ emissions for underground storage.

The project, built at an Archer Daniels Midland site, marks a new step in Googleâ€™s push for 24/7 clean energy as AI data center demand surges. 

ADM will also be able to purchase power from the plant once it comes online in the early 2030s.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/hnF-R1vrJ2Wl-Ampdi8ZS9VN162BZyvBuzmGWmqbBKM/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G383WYeWIAAuRos.jpg

[23/10/2025 17:18] Palantir â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/PalantirTech/status/1981364433151471999)

{Embed}
Palantir (@PalantirTech)
https://twitter.com/PalantirTech/status/1981364433151471999
Scott Sudder, Southern California Edison
10/23/2025

I wake up every morning thinking about one thing: keeping everyone safe. That's it. That's what drives me.

I work for an electric utility provider on our public safety team. My father worked for the electrical utility tooâ€”maybe it's in my blood. I spent 20 years in the Marines working on aircraft electronics, and there are certainly similarities when it comes to safety. What I do now is different, but the mission is still the same: get the work done and keep people safe. Itâ€™s a great responsibility, and the stakes couldn't be higher. 

Our communities are surrounded by high-risk fire areas and the changing climate has made everything drier. This means more fuel, more risk and high consequences in the areas we serve. Every single day, 24/7, 365 days a year, we monitor weather conditions so that the electric grid will not be the cause of a wildfire. That's our calling, from the executives on down. And here's the thing: we live in these same communities, ringed in by those same high-risk fire areas too. We're not just protecting customersâ€”we're protecting our neighbors, our families, and ourselves.

Today, thanks to AI and automation, we've transformed a lot of this work. We evaluate and analyze 15 to 20 advanced weather models, including enhanced machine learning models, that help us detect risk in areas that were historically difficult for us to evaluate before. That's a paradigm shift. We can ingest information faster and make decisions with better data on a much larger scale. What used to take our team 8 to 10 hours of manual work (figuring out which customers to notify, what to tell them, analyzing changes in weather forecasts) now takes just under an hour. This isn't just efficiency; it's the difference between customers getting advance warnings or entering a risky period without any notification.

Here's what people should understand about our journey: AI didn't replace our incident management team. Absolutely notâ€”thatâ€™s as dangerous as it is impossible. American workers have something AI never will; an innate ability to understand consequences in ways that go far beyond data.

Instead, AI made us better at protecting lives, reducing risk, and keeping our customers and partners informed. We're risk-averse, and we must be. Having better information at our fingertips to make decisions keeps us informed of the risks that are out there. When the consequences are this great, enhanced capability means everything. It's a heavy responsibility, but we must do it, and I'm proud that American ingenuity and technology are helping us do it better.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/dQtlc3Oc2HRmxNDcjG__LiTXqrtSXnOT1xrwCKAtbaI/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G384SFRXYAALYai.jpg
TweetShift â€¢ ğŸ“·1

Crusoe, the AI infrastructure provider building OpenAIâ€™s first major U.S. data center, raised $1.4 billion in new funding, tripling its valuation to over $10 billion in just a year, according to the Financial Times. 

The round was led by Mubadala Capital and Valor Equity Partners, bringing total capital raised to about $3.9 billion.

Crusoe is constructing a 1.2GW AI campus in Abilene, Texas, for OpenAI, a project expected to cost around $12 billion and finish by mid-2026, and another 1.8GW site in Wyoming. The companyâ€™s full development pipeline now totals 45GW of capacity, roughly equivalent to the power needs of eight to ten New York Cities.

CEO Chase Lochmiller said the demand for compute infrastructure is unlike anything heâ€™s seen, as AI spending by tech giants is projected to exceed $500 billion annually by 2026.

JPMorgan Upgrades $COIN to Overweight from Neutral, Raises PT to $404.00 from $342.00

Analyst comments: "We are upgrading Coinbase to Overweight as we look ahead to emerging monetization opportunities and abating risks at what we see as an attractive valuation versus cryptocurrency peers. In particular, we call out two opportunities we see Coinbase as exploring, which could be meaningful to Coinbase equity value.

We see Coinbase exploring a Base token, which we believe could accelerate the growth of development on the Base blockchain while enabling Coinbase to equitize the success in what is the largest Layer 2 on multiple metrics. We also see Coinbase further exploring its USDC payouts. We currently estimate Coinbase pays in excess of $1.00 per share (excluding the higher payout for Coinbase One accounts, which we expect will persist), indicating that client segmentation could be substantially additive to EPS should Coinbase choose to move in this direction.

We are launching our 2027 estimates and establishing a December 2026 price target of $404."

Analyst: Kenneth Worthington
TweetShift


[24/10/2025 10:52] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1981629715090923793)

{Embed}
Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§
https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1981629715090923793
Global PC shipments rose 8.1% in Q3, marking the strongest growth in years as the end of Windows 10 support triggered a broad replacement cycle. 

With about 40% of computers worldwide still running the older OS before the October deadline, both consumers and companies rushed to upgrade their systems.

Lenovo led the market with 17% YoY growth, driven by commercial demand, while HP followed with a 10% increase. 

Apple also saw strong momentum with shipments up 15% on the back of new MacBook models and growing enterprise use. 

Counterpoint Analyst say this upgrade wave is setting the stage for the next phase of growth, centered on AI-capable PCs expected to take off from 2026 onward.

Stifel Downgrades $SNAP to Sell from Hold, Lowers PT to $6.50 from $8.00

Analyst comments: "We are downgrading Snap to a Sell rating as our checks suggest that advertising revenue growth will continue to slow â€” equating to ceding market share â€” as Snapchat is not an 'always-on' platform for budgets, and advertisers are increasingly drawn away from Snapchat for incremental test budgets.

Our downgrade is predicated on three key points: (1) our checks have become more negative over time despite a relatively healthy advertising backdrop over the last 18+ months, primarily driven by a lack of unique audience with spendable income; (2) the platformâ€™s most easily monetized surfaces remain underutilized, and social messaging has historically been difficult to monetize; and (3) Snapâ€™s ad tools and solutions have failed to keep up with peers, creating a further hurdle to advertising budget allocation.

We reflect continued market share loss in our forward advertising revenue estimates, and our price target moves to $6.50."

Analyst: Mark Kelley

Goldman Sachs Reiterates Sell Rating on $AAL, PT $10

Analyst comments: "American reported a 3Q25 beat, introduced a better-than-expected 4Q25 revenue outlook, and as a result raised its FY 2025 EPS guidance to $0.65 to $0.95 from $0.30 at the midpoint prior. AAL shares closed up approximately 5.5%, outperforming our coverage ex-AAL, which was down around 2.5%.

We believe the primary driver of todayâ€™s positive stock reaction is the better-than-expected 4Q EPS outlook of $0.60 at the midpoint, well ahead of FactSet consensus and Goldman Sachs estimates of $0.30 and $0.33, respectively, heading into the print. We believe this was further bolstered by positioning into the print, based on our recent investor conversations.

The above-consensus 4Q EPS outlook is primarily driven by better-than-expected unit revenue (RASM) guidance of flat year-over-year, ahead of consensus at -1.4% and investor expectations. Similar to network peers, American called out that transatlantic should see a significant sequential improvement into 4Q, with the Pacific network also expected to see a material improvement.

Better-than-expected 4Q revenue trends, in conjunction with the 3Q beat, drive our improved FY 2025 EPS estimate of $0.80 versus $0.35 prior. While we are encouraged by the improved earnings outlook into year-end, there is no change to our FY 2026 and FY 2027 EPS estimates of $1.85 and $2.30, respectively, as our improved revenue outlook is offset by higher unit cost inflation.

Our $10 price target (unchanged) represents 22% downside to current levels; reiterate Sell."

Analyst: Catherine Oâ€™Brien

Canaccord Genuity Raises $ATAI PT to $14.00 from $11.00 - Buy "significantly undervalued"

Analyst comments: "ATAI, which is on track to merge with Beckley (private) in 4Q25, recently announced that the FDA granted breakthrough therapy designation (BTD) to Beckleyâ€™s BPL-003 (intranasal mebufotenin), which had solid Phase 2 data for treatment-resistant depression. The company also raised approximately $139 million in net proceeds from an offering, which it said would extend its cash runway into 2029.
Importantly, this runway is catalyst-rich as it includes: (1) an expected top-line readout on the first proposed Phase 3 trial for BPL-003 in treatment-resistant depression; (2) completion of a Phase 2 trial for VLS-01 (DMT buccal film for treatment-resistant depression); and (3) completion of a Phase 2a trial for EMP-01 (oral R-MDMA) for social anxiety disorder. With BTD now in hand, ATAI-Beckley expects to discuss Phase 3 design with the FDA and initiate the pivotal Phase 3 program in 2Q26.

While the stock has been very strong year-to-date (+341%; XBI: +21.7%; SPX: +14.5%), we continue to see room for upside on BPL-003 retreatment data, potential alignment with the FDA on Phase 3 design, and other upcoming data. We also await the closing of the ATAI-Beckley merger, which we continue to view as a solid strategic move, and the planned re-domicile from the Netherlands to the U.S., which has implications for potential index inclusion.

For investors with a longer-term mindset, we continue to view ATAI, which has a multi-asset psychedelic therapeutic pipeline, as significantly undervalued relative to the size of the unmet need and market opportunity in the mental health-focused indications it is targeting. Reiterate Buy."

Analyst: Sumant Kulkarni

Stifel Reiterates Buy Rating on $MSFT, PT $650; Earnings Preview

Analyst comments: "While Microsoft posted a near 'perfect print' last quarter (Azure +400bps, EPS +700bps), the stock quickly shed its momentum and has trailed the IGV by approximately 5 percentage points since. We believe the keys to getting the stock back on track include another strong Azure print, sustained operating margin momentum, and insights into the OpenAI relationship.

Based on investor conversations, buyside expectations call for at least a ~300bps Azure beat (40%+ year-over-year in constant currency) and a FY2Q26 constant-currency guide of ~37â€“38% (assuming 100â€“200bps of conservatism). We believe these targets seem reasonable given recent Azure beats (300bps and 400bps, respectively, in the last two quarters) and current enterprise spending trends. Anything less would be disappointing.

On the profitability front, the 150â€“200bps of year-over-year FY26 gross-margin compression caused by the Azure mix shift is well understood by investors, and we remain confident in managementâ€™s ability to leverage its increasingly capex-centric business, limit operating expense growth to low single digits, and drive mid-teens EPS growth in coming quarters and years."

The Pentagon said it received an anonymous $130 million donation to pay U.S. troops during the government shutdown, but legal experts say the move may violate federal law. 

Spokesman Sean Parnell said the money was accepted under the Defense Departmentâ€™s gift authority and earmarked for service membersâ€™ pay and benefits. Federal law, however, bars private donors from directing money for specific government uses without congressional approval.

The donation reportedly came from a â€œfriendâ€ of President Trump, who has been seeking ways to fund military pay amid the shutdown. Legal experts note the Pentagon can only accept private gifts in limited cases, such as for military schools or aid to wounded service members and their families.

Even if allowed, $130 million would cover less than one day of payroll for the U.S. militaryâ€™s 1.3 million active-duty members.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/9Liso-VM-8Ig9oTt3l3-sWbEfSO59Gv8xZczDKbxuR4/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4CWdtIWsAA1Qky.png

A new report from The Information says OpenAI is pushing monetization. Inside the company, some staff are saying it has become another $META, with a growth over everything mindset.

The company is adding engagement features like ChatGPT suggesting follow up tasks so users stay chatting longer. At the same time, they are improving daily tools like checking stocks, sports scores and weather. 

But they are also adding a feature that will tell users to take a break if they have been using the chatbot for too long, which feels like a strange contradiction.

Even the research group is feeling the shift. Post training work is now being measured on engagement metrics instead of just making the model better. Some employees say that is the clearest sign that OpenAI is turning into the kind of engagement machine it once criticized.

One employee says: We do not want to become engagement farmers.

OpenAI is trying to balance two identities. But that balance is getting harder to hold

That balance is getting harder to hold.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/bEFpZcNdWFB0K5t5fX6tJ3g1DCfptIm1LqdSNQq5oS4/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4GXlluWUAAzjua.jpg

[25/10/2025 23:10] Palmer Luckey â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/PalmerLuckey/status/1982178031117758531)

{Embed}
Palmer Luckey (@PalmerLuckey) âœ§
https://twitter.com/PalmerLuckey/status/1982178031117758531
California (more specifically, the state legislature and Gavin Newsom) just banned Glocks, the most common firearms in the country by far, for being "unsafe", claiming they are too easy to convert into machine guns.

The government claims Glock could have updated their designs to make these illegal conversions harder, that their refusal to do so puts blood on their hands.

In reality, California law is the reason those updates were never made!  California (more specifically, Kamala Harris) decided in 2001 that all new handgun designs needed to include microstamping, a non-existent but patented technology that engraves every round with two unique serial numbers as they are fired.  Existing designs were grandfathered in, but any changes whatsoever, even texture or color changes, would require this new non-existent technology.  It is worth noting that she did so by specifically warranting that the technology was commercially available, which triggered a provision in an existing piece of legislation despite not being true.

As a result, California has been stuck with Glocks designed in 1998.  There have been several generations of updates in every other state that make them safer in a variety of ways.  It is crazy to blame Glock for not updating their designs in California when the law prohibits them from doing so.
TweetShift

[27/10/2025 3:38] amit â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1982622555128070341)

{Embed}
amit (@amitisinvesting) âœ§
https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1982622555128070341
so you're telling me...

we are about to cut rates into a market that's at all time highs AND is putting up double-digit earnings growth?

this could be a really solid run towards end of year, here's some of the dynamics for why:

- we just had a 3% drawdown on the S&P which resulted in some 30% drawdowns for individual names, regardless of what you think of those names, it likely was needed to get some of the froth out of the system to allow the next leg higher

- the reason for that 3% drawdown was because of China-US tensions, we aren't out of the woods but if we are closer to being out of the woods...markets will be very happy

- more geopolitical peace around the world is a tailwind, potential russia/ukraine ceasefire could be next

- earnings have been INCREDIBLE so far, whether it's banks or semiconductors or clothing...almost every company is beating on the top and bottom with EPS beats way ahead of the street...potentially showing AI is a tailwind for margins

- AI capex not slowing down

- if we see the big tech companies produce some monster numbers this week...it will only reinforce why AI is so important and why the multiple on the broader market is expanding

- 7.4T still on the sidelines

- gov reopening will be good

- $NVDA may be able to sell to China soon if the deal allows it which would be a massive tailwind for all semis and AI capex

plenty of things to be concerned about (like labor market) but overall macro tailwinds with fed easing and AI does seem to support a strong bull case

Analyst comments: "We are upgrading Honeywell from Sector Perform to Outperform following a solid 3Q25 that, in our view, marks the start of the breakup catalyst-rich phase heading into the planned 2H26 separation of Aerospace and Automation. We see growing momentum across core segments, improved visibility on execution, and a credible roadmap toward value unlock. Our sum-of-the-parts valuation implies attractive upside. With management executing well, separation milestones approaching, and â€˜deal purgatoryâ€™ perceptions fading, we believe investor focus will shift to the structural upside embedded in two strong standalone franchises positioned for sustainable growth and margin expansion."

Analyst: Deane Dray

$BMNR $ETH

Bitmine now owns 3.31M ETH after buying 71K coins last week, now owning 2.8% of the entire supply. 

Tom Lee:

â€œThe progress in trade talks between US and China is a positive for Ethereum and crypto broadly. These are global assets and rising tensions triggered the largest ever deleveraging in crypto a few weeks ago. While the fundamentals of Ethereum and crypto are 'uncorrelated' to equities, Fundstrat work has shown that in the past 15 years, Ethereum and crypto perform better when equities rise, meaning crypto is correlated to 'risk-on' assets via the associated leverage channel. Open interest for ETH sits at the same levels as seen on June 30th of this year (ETHwas $2,500). Given the expected Supercycle for Ethereum, this price dislocation represents an attractive risk/reward. We increased our cash holdings to $305 million (from $219 million) and acquired 77,055 ETH tokens over the past week pushing our ETH holdings to 3.31 million, or 2.8% of the supply of ETH.â€

TD Cowen Reiterates Buy Rating on $AAPL, PT $275

Analyst comments: "iPhone and seasonality to drive favorable sentiment into year-end. We expect Apple to report September quarter revenue in line with or above the Streetâ€™s +7.5% year-over-year estimate and to guide December quarter revenue up high-single-digits, with iPhone units up low-single-digits year-over-year. iPhone 17 demand driven by replacements could evolve into an even stronger artificial intelligence (AI) upgrade cycle in calendar year 2026 and beyond.

We model Services revenue up +13% year-over-year as Google search advertising revenue remains intact. Apple stock sentiment is markedly positive given the encouraging consumer reception for the iPhone 17 and the sustained search ad revenue stream from Google. While current iOS AI features support demand, we believe higher-performance hardware features in the second half of 2026 will further accelerate iPhone growth. We expect December quarter guidance to reflect solid seasonality with revenue up high-single-digits year-over-year."

Analyst: Krish Sankar

Rosenblatt: 'There is room for $QCOM to generate significant AI inference related revenue longer-term'

Analyst comments: "We view today's announcement as positive for the Qualcomm shares for the longer-term. For years management's strategy has been to diversify its end markets while growing its smartphone market share." 

"Landing a 200MW deployment with HUMAIN is a very good step in a new growth vector in AI inference data centers. As a reminder, in May this year AMD and HUMAIN announced a 500MW deployment worth $10B." 

"While revenue details have not been provided, we expect Qualcomm's deployment with HUMAIN may generate ~$2B. Deployment is expected to start in 2026. Inference stage AI market is expected to be $250B+ by 2030 and growing ~20% annually. There is room for Qualcomm to generate significant AI inference related revenue longer-term."

$QQQ $SPY | Nomura: Tension-Escalation-Truce Cycle Becomes New Normal for U.S.-China Relations

Nomura's Chief China Economist, Lu Ting, highlights that U.S.-China relations are entering a recurring cycle of tension, escalation, and temporary truce. 

Recent trade talks in Kuala Lumpur indicate eased tensions, with potential concessions such as extended tariff truces and resumed Chinese purchases of U.S. soybeans. 

However, unresolved issues like rare earth exports, trade agreement compliance, and geopolitical disputes may trigger renewed conflicts. Lu predicts that while both sides remain interdependent in the short term, competition between the two superpowers will inevitably escalate, making this cyclical pattern the new normal.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/Bjn8-bnI7-W47E9474fBAgpJvMx16EgYd_MEnVVzbpc/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4UAN-7WwAAsHfk.jpg

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: $CRCL Goldman, BlackRock Sign Up to Trial Circleâ€™s Arc Blockchain

Stablecoin issuer Circle Internet Group Inc. has launched the test version of its Arc blockchain, with firms including Goldman Sachs, BlackRock, Apollo Global Management, Anthropic, and Intercontinental Exchange signing up to trial the technology. Arc, designed to process stablecoin payments directly, is now open for developers and businesses to test and build on. 

â€œExploring Arc will provide insight into how stablecoin-denominated settlement and onchain FX capabilities might enable more efficient capital markets,â€ said Robert Mitchnick, BlackRockâ€™s global head of digital assets. Anthropic plans to integrate its Claude large language models on Arc to give developers AI tools, while other testnet participants include HSBC, State Street, Deutsche Bank, Standard Chartered, and Invesco. Circle CEO Jeremy Allaire said, â€œWe want to play a really broad role in the development of this new economic system.â€

Wayfair $W, the online home goods retailer, posted stronger-than-expected Q3 results with adj EPS of $0.70 and revenue of $3.1B, slightly above estimates. US sales rose 8.6% and revenue excluding Germany was up 9% YoY. 

Management said the pickup is coming from market share gains, pricing and delivery improvements, and its loyalty program, not tariffs or interest rates. Adjusted EBITDA margin reached 6.7%, the best outside the pandemic.

$QXO, the largest publicly traded distributor of roofing and building products in North America, is launching a refinancing of its Term Loan B. Alongside that, they posted preliminary Q3 results: $2.73B in net sales, a GAAP net loss of $139M, and adjusted EBITDA of $302M. Adjusted EPS came in at $0.14. They ended the quarter with $2.3B in cash and $3.1B in debt. Final numbers will be filed Nov. 6.

U.S. ADP just launched weekly employment estimates to give a more real-time read on the labor market. 

The first release shows an average gain of 14,250 private-sector jobs over the four weeks ending Oct. 11. 

Weekly data will drop every Tuesday at 8:15am ET, alongside the usual monthly report coming Nov. 5.

$ADBE rolled out a huge wave of AI upgrades across Creative Cloud:

Adobe has added partner AI models from Google, OpenAI, Runway, Topaz and ElevenLabs for things like smarter generative fill, upscaling and audio creation. 

Photoshop now has an AI Assistant that handles repetitive tasks through chat while keeping full creative control. 

Firefly Image Model 5 is live in public beta and can generate 4MP images with prompt-based editing. 

Businesses get new tools in GenStudio to scale branded content, plus Firefly Foundry to build custom AI models trained on their own IP. 

Most features are available today with more rolling out over the next few months.

MICROSOFT $MSFT AND OPENAI JUST UPDATEd THEIR RELATIONSHIP

"The agreement preserves key elements that have fueled this successful partnershipâ€”meaning OpenAI remains Microsoftâ€™s frontier model partner and Microsoft continues to have exclusive IP rights and Azure API exclusivity until Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)."

Here is what is changing:

- Once AGI is declared by OpenAI, that declaration will now be verified by an independent expert panel.

- Microsoftâ€™s IP rights for both models and products are extended through 2032 and now includes models post-AGI, with appropriate safety guardrails.

- Microsoftâ€™s IP rights to research, defined as the confidential methods used in the development of models and systems, will remain until either the expert panel verifies AGI or through 2030, whichever is first. Research IP includes, for example, models intended for internal deployment or research only. Beyond that, research IP does not include model architecture, model weights, inference code, finetuning code, and any IP related to data center hardware and software; and Microsoft retains these non-Research IP rights.

- Microsoftâ€™s IP rights now exclude OpenAIâ€™s consumer hardware.

- OpenAI can now jointly develop some products with third parties. API products developed with third parties will be exclusive to Azure. Non-API products may be served on any cloud provider.

- Microsoft can now independently pursue AGI alone or in partnership with third parties.

- If Microsoft uses OpenAIâ€™s IP to develop AGI, prior to AGI being declared, the models will be subject to compute thresholds; those thresholds are significantly larger than the size of systems used to train leading models today.

- The revenue share agreement remains until the expert panel verifies AGI, though payments will be made over a longer period of time.

- OpenAI has contracted to purchase an incremental $250B of Azure services, and Microsoft will no longer have a right of first refusal to be OpenAIâ€™s compute provider.

- OpenAI can now provide API access to US government national security customers, regardless of the cloud provider.

- OpenAI is now able to release open weight models that meet requisite capability criteria.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/xmtKRo5d-N4FG1nidtcUBjP37WUaK-zCvV5GSCSYydg/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4WYlXoWMAAy1Zi.jpg

Barclays $BCS is buying Best Egg for $800M, betting big on US consumer lending 

Best Egg originates unsecured personal loans that Barclays can package into asset-backed securities for its investment banking clients. 

The platform has about $11B in loans and expects to originate $7B more this year. Barclays says the deal will boost returns and expands its US consumer finance business.

KeyBanc Upgrades $SWKS to Overweight from Sector Weight, Sets PT at $105

Analyst comments: "We upgrade Skyworks Solutions following the merger announcement with Qorvo. Our upgrade is based on: (1) The merger being highly complementary, combining Skyworksâ€™ strong execution track record with Qorvoâ€™s best-in-class RF technologies and superior BAW filter capabilities; (2) Consolidation of a maturing subsector, which should result in improved pricing and margin expansion; and (3) Over $500 million in cost synergies, leading us to forecast $7.46 in EPS for calendar year 2027. While the deal carries risk given the expected 18-month closing timeline and required China approval, we see a favorable risk/reward profile with SWKS trading at 11x our 2027 EPS estimate. Additionally, we are raising estimates for both Qorvo and Skyworks to reflect the positive September quarter preannouncement."

Analyst: John Vinh

DA Davidson on $NVDA (Buy, PT $250):

We believe that the market is currently discounting upside to data center revenue through FY26.

We continue to believe the market may be underestimating the insatiable demand for compute. Management stated that they expect the Blackwell/Rubin generations in 2025/26 to generate $500B of revenue off of 20M GPUs sold, with 6M GPUs already shipped, with consensus estimating data center revenue through that time period at approximately $366B; guidance that's now ~37% above where consensus is. 

That being said, we do not believe that the market is appropriately pricing in the upside to these numbers. To that end, we see no reason to change our perspective on the capabilities of models today and future models, while we see the current levels of demand for compute from labs like OpenAI as justified and do not believe we're reaching levels warranting the characterization of 'overbuilding'.

BofA on Bloom Energy $BE: 'Strong headline beat, but optimism likely priced in'

Bloom Energy posted a solid 3Q topline and margin beat (revenue $519M, +57% YoY; GM 30.4%), driven by AI-linked data-center deployments and early Brookfield JV projects. While MW growth and FY25 guidance upside validate commercial traction, we see this largely priced in amid consensus expectations for accelerating AI power demand. The quarter does little to resolve uncertainty around true project economics, cash conversion, and sustainability of Brookfield-driven volumes. We look to update our numbers following our management callback and will incorporate insights from our upcoming expert panel with former Bloom and Microsoft executives on SOFC deployment.

BofA Securities Raises $TSLA PT to $471 from $341 - Neutral 

Analyst comments: "We raise our price objective to $471, continuing to base our valuation on a SOTP analysis derived from a DCF model extending through 2040. We estimate that Teslaâ€™s core automotive business represents approximately 12% of total value, while the Robotaxi segment accounts for 45%, Full Self-Driving (FSD) 17%, Energy Generation & Storage around 6%, and Optimus 19%. The upward revision in our price objective reflects a lower cost of equity capital, stronger progress in Robotaxi development, and an increased valuation for Optimus to capture potential international market expansion."

Apple $AAPL is preparing to bring OLED displays to more of its mainstream devices, per Bloomberg. MacBook Air, iPad mini, and iPad Air models with OLED panels are being tested, with the iPad mini likely first, possibly next year. 

OLED improves contrast and color, but adds cost, so pricing may rise by around $100 on the mini.

Apple has also tested a new water-resistant casing and vibration-based speaker design for the mini. 

The next iPad Air refresh will still use LCD, but Apple plans to move the model to OLED after that. The entry-level iPad currently has no OLED transition planned.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/3NkG15pa983r0wegXirKEDU41pHSL1nvfQcHZ8jdXrQ/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4a11PrawAA4-DB.png
TweetShift â€¢ ğŸ“·1

BofA Securities Raises $NVDA PT to $275 from $235 - Buy 

Analyst comments: "We hosted a highly positive meeting with NVIDIA CFO Colette Kress and members of the investor relations team following the CEOâ€™s keynote at the GTC trade show in Washington, D.C. The discussions reinforced our confidence in NVIDIAâ€™s: (1) Solid visibility for calendar years 2025 and 2026, supported by over $0.5 trillion in orders at a conservative $25 billion per gigawatt versus potential for $30 billion+; (2) Strong alignment across the supply chain, including multiple memory suppliers; (3) Zero China expectations, with any trade resolution being incremental; (4) Continued leadership over ASIC and GPU competitors, who lack NVIDIAâ€™s deployment experience (NVIDIA already in its second-generation GB300 racks); and (5) A robust multi-year pipelineâ€”Rubin on track for 2H26Eâ€”driving expansion into new markets such as Nokia 6G, Uber self-driving cars, industrial twins, and robotics.

We view valuation at 32x/25x CY26E/27E P/E as compelling, given it represents less than 1x the earnings growth rate (PEG ratio) versus broader 'Mag-7' and growth peers trading above 2x. We raise our price objective to $275 from $235 on a higher 44x CY26E P/E multiple (up from 37x), which equates to 35x on the ~$8 EPS power outlined by NVIDIA, consistent with historical valuation levels."

Analyst: Vivek Arya

$GOOGL Public Sector continues to rack up wins in state and local government 

ODU just launched â€œMonarchSphere,â€ an AI incubator built with Google Cloud. Theyâ€™re using Vertex AI and Gemini models to speed up research and streamline campus operations. One example: genomic AI training workloads that used to take ~24â€“40 days on-prem now finish in 2â€“3 days. ODU is also rolling out AI tools for advising, curriculum development, and career support â€” and joining Googleâ€™s AI for Education Accelerator to expand workforce training.

At the same time, Los Angeles has deployed Google Workspace with Gemini AI to all 27,500 city employees as part of its SmartLA 2028 digital modernization. Theyâ€™re using it for multilingual communication, document summarization, and data analysis across 45 agencies â€” with full AI ethics training completed for the workforce.

Maryland has also enabled Gemini AI in Google Workspace for 43,000 state employees across 59 agencies, with 12,500 already active users. Teams are applying it to website development, chatbot creation, and sentiment analysis under the stateâ€™s Responsible AI policy.

$FUBO and Disney $DIS have officially closed the Hulu + Live TV merger, creating a business with close to 6 million subscribers in North America. 

That makes it the sixth largest pay TV provider in the United States. Disney now owns about 70 percent of the combined company, while Fubo shareholders retain about 30 percent.

Both services will continue to operate separately. Hulu + Live TV will stay inside the Hulu, Disney+, and ESPN Unlimited bundle, and Fubo will continue with its own app focused on sports viewers.

Fubo CEO David Gandler will lead the combined operations. Fuboâ€™s advertising sales group will now be handled by Disneyâ€™s advertising team. The companies expect savings on content costs and better advertising revenue. Disney has also committed to a 145 million dollar term loan in 2026.

[29/10/2025 14:40] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1983514015050727665)

{Embed}
Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§
https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1983514015050727665
Nvidia $NVDA is supporting a new Digital Realty data center in Virginia, called Aurora, focused on reducing power strain. 

The facility will use Emerald AI software that shifts computing workloads in real time based on grid conditions. 

A prior test showed the technology could lower power consumption by about 25 percent for several hours during periods of high grid stress while maintaining service.

The project is part of a new flexible power certification developed with Nvidia, Emerald AI, the Electric Power Research Institute, and the PJM regional grid operator. 

The approach is meant to help data centers better manage electricity use as the industry expands and as more renewable energy comes online.

Source: Axios
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/uX4BCJejWRjMe3o1bmw1kYDakR7n6z7p-3GW1zZix7w/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G4bbdT9bgAA3iKQ.jpg

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: $ORCL 'Oracle Default Swaps Jump on Concerns Over AI Spending Spree' - Bloomberg

Credit traders are increasingly buying protection against Oracle Corp. defaulting on its debt, a trend Morgan Stanley expects to continue as the company invests billions in artificial intelligence. 

The cost to insure Oracleâ€™s debt over the next five years is near its highest level since October 2023, according to ICE Data Services. Morgan Stanley projects Oracleâ€™s net adjusted debt will more than double to roughly $290 billion by fiscal year 2028 from around $100 billion and recommends investors buy the companyâ€™s five-year CDS and bonds. 

Analysts Lindsay Tyler and David Hamburger noted that â€œnear-term credit deterioration and uncertainty may drive further bondholder and lender hedging.â€

Do pay attention to debt chart and growth.

"We expect a significant reduction in our U.S. federal cash tax payments for the remainder of 2025 and future years due to the implementation of the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. However, the implementation also led to the recognition of a valuation allowance against our U.S. federal deferred tax assets, reflecting the impact of the U.S. Corporate Alternative Minimum Tax. As a result, the third quarter 2025 provision for income taxes includes a one-time, non-cash income tax charge of $15.93 billion."

Inflation is accelerating into the mid-single digit range, primarily due to tariffs and rising beef... Underlying trends remained challenged throughout the quarter & into October.

Tariffs impacted Q3 by ~30 bps and we estimate an ongoing ~50 bps impact for the year, excluding USMCA-exempt imports

Trump called his meeting with Xi â€œamazingâ€ and rated it â€œ12 out of 10,â€ and said broader trade is coming soon. 

Key Takeaways:

â€¢ Fentanyl-related tariffs cut to 10% effective immediately. Broader U.S. tariffs on China reduced to 47% from 57%

â€¢ China will â€œstart immediatelyâ€ buying U.S. soybeans and China will remove â€œroadblocksâ€ on rare-earth exports for at least a year.

â€¢ Chips discussions will continue; $NVDA can talk directly with China. Trump said they were â€œnot talking about Blackwell.â€

â€¢ The U.S. will postpone its probe into Chinese shipbuilding,

â€¢ Taiwan did not come up.

â€¢ Trump will visit China in April; Xi was invited to visit the U.S. afterward.

â€¢ Joint cooperation pledged on Ukraine, trade, and AI

â€¢ XI: China is willing to work with U.S.

TRUMP ON CHINA:

I had a truly great meeting with President Xi of China. There is enormous respect between our two Countries, and that will only be enhanced with what just took place. We agreed on many things, with others, even of high importance, being very close to resolved. 

I was extremely honored by the fact that President Xi authorized China to begin the purchase of massive amounts of Soybeans, Sorghum, and other Farm products. 

Additionally, China has agreed to continue the flow of Rare Earth, Critical Minerals, Magnets, etc., openly and freely. 

Very significantly, China has strongly stated that they will work diligently with us to stop the flow of Fentanyl into our Country. They will help us end the Fentanyl Crisis. 

China also agreed that they will begin the process of purchasing American Energy. In fact, a very large scale transaction may take place concerning the purchase of Oil and Gas from the Great State of Alaska. 

Chris Wright, Doug Burgum, and our respective Energy teams will be meeting to see if such an Energy Deal can be worked out. 

The agreements reached today will deliver Prosperity and Security to millions of Americans. After this Historic trip to Asia, I am now heading back to Washington, D.C. 

I want to thank the Great Countries of Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea for being so generous, gracious, and hospitable â€” Also, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam, who were at the Dinner last night hosted by His Excellency Lee Jae Myung. Wells Fargo on $META: 

"Clearly this was the worst of the bunch. The language on 2026 operating expenses and capital expenditures again took another step function higher qualitatively. While META did not explicitly give us anything, clearly they are signaling much higher starting points for next year versus what everyone was thinking. The setup was that we were not expecting anything to materially alter the buy-side model calculation on the 3Q call from a cost standpoint. That did not happen.

On top of that, 4Q revenue is $1 billion below the whisper. Bulls are defending it, blaming assumptions on foreign exchange not being as big in terms of the assumed headwind. That is fair, but (1) EPS is calculated off reported revenue and (2) optically, while we can debate how big of a deal this is at face value, when you do the beat math and calculate the new exit rate to help inform your view of 2026 revenue, it is coming down.

So the net of that is buy-side revenue lower next year, operating expenses and capital expenditures higher, so that $34â€“35 people had penciled in now looks more like $32. On top of that, from a narrative standpoint, there is a re-emerging view that META is spending on Capex and AI like it is a frontier model builder but has nothing to show for it in terms of return. It is not making money renting out the GPUs like GOOG or MSFT, and it does not seem to have a real new monetizable product in the near term. So estimates get whacked and now the narrative too. Less conversation on 2027, but early chatter is 2027 EPS now more mid-$30s."

Goldman Sachs on $CMG, Lowers PT to $45 from $52 - Buy

Analyst comments: "We acknowledge near-term inflationary headwinds (now expecting mid-single-digit inflation in 4Q25/2026E) and industry-wide macro pressures expected to weigh on traffic amid challenges faced by Chipotle's core consumers in younger and lower income cohorts (<$100k). Management noted reservations around pricing, with no immediate plans to take incremental price in 4Q (despite rolling off 2% in December) and an intention to price below inflation to keep the brand's value proposition strong for pressured consumers.

We model same-store sales growth (SSSG) of -3.6% for 4Q25E, translating to -1.9% for FY2025E, followed by a more subdued recovery of 1.5% in 2026E (vs. 3.3% assumed prior). We continue to like CMG's long-term growth story and remain encouraged by the companyâ€™s commitment to culinary innovation (3â€“4 protein LTOs per year vs. 2 historically) and its increased focus on operations, digital, and marketing under the 'Recipe for Growth' strategy. With some macro improvement, we see opportunity for transaction-driven comp growth long term."

Goldman Sachs Raises $GOOGL PT to $330 from $288; Recap:

1) Search & Other demonstrated strong growth (including management disclosing that both paid clicks and CPCs grew +7% YoY) demonstrating broad-based strength across verticals; 

2) the YouTube complex (Ads + Subscriptions) showing continued momentum with YouTube Ads growth of +15% YoY and management highlighting the growing contribution from subscription offerings; 

3) Google Cloud was the highlight of the results (in our view) with +34% YoY revenue growth, +79% YoY revenue backlog growth, 23% segment operating margins and a host of positive commentary from management on the earnings call; 

4) continued balance of operating efficiencies to fund growth investments while still producing a normalized upward margin trajectory; and 

5) long-term upside optionality inside the Alphabet structure with Waymo and quantum computing. A change of 2025 capex guidance from ~$85bn to a range of $91â€“93bn results in an adjustment in our forward forecast, while management was not ready to guide to 2026 capex at this point, we have adjusted our 2026 capex estimate to ~$122bn (+32% YoY)."
