UBS SAYS S&P 500 COULD HIT 7,500 IN 2026

UBS is forecasting the S&P 500 to reach 7,500 next year, driven by ~14% earnings growth, with nearly half of that coming from tech. 

They see a â€œsoft patchâ€ in the near term as tariffs work through the economy, but expect growth to pick up later in 2026 as confidence and fiscal support improve.

UBS expects gains to come mainly from earnings, not higher valuations, and thinks the rally could broaden beyond mega-cap tech by mid-2026. 

They still see the U.S. outperforming Europe and EM, and prefer equities over credit heading into next year.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/EjfqGSWCeH3HRuyvP9iX-9E7l0en0TeEdDlmqoMr3BI/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5ZUzvTbMAAJR2R.jpg

$COIN IS LAUNCHING A NEW TOKEN SALES PLATFORM

Coinbase will now let retail investors buy tokens before they list, hosting about one sale per month and allocating purchases via an algorithm during a one-week window. Buyers will use USDC, and projects must meet Coinbase vetting criteria. Monad will be the first token offered next week. 

To avoid 2017-style â€œdump and run,â€ early sellers get reduced future allocations, and project teams canâ€™t sell for 6 months.

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: $BULL Webull launches AI-powered investment tool Vega for US customers

Webull announced the launch of Vega, an AI-powered investment tool designed to provide personalized market analysis and portfolio insights to investors. The online investment platform introduced the tool on November 10, 2025, making it available at no cost to US customers.

Vega offers five key features: Options Statistics Insights that identifies outliers in options chains, Data Summary for unified market data analysis, Portfolio Review to evaluate investment strategies, Plain-Language Orders allowing voice commands for trading, and Vega Insights delivering personalized alerts based on user portfolios and watchlists.

Warren Buffett posted his annual Thanksgiving letter. 

He said to stop writing Berkshireâ€™s annual report and is â€œgoing quietâ€ as Greg Abel becomes CEO at year end. 

He has converted 1,800 A shares into 2.7M B and donated about $1.1B to four family foundations. 

He will keep a significant amount of A shares until shareholders gain comfort with Abel. 

He says the gift acceleration does not change his Berkshire outlook. 

â€œGreatness does not come about through accumulating great amounts of moneyâ€¦ Kindness is costless but also priceless.â€

WARREN BUFFETT JUST SENT WHAT COULD BE HIS LAST MESSAGE TO BERKSHIRE HATHAWAY $BRK.B SHAREHOLDERS AS CEO OF THE COMPANY

Here is the full and entire 8 page press release Warren Buffett just released â¬‡ï¸â¬‡ï¸

To My Fellow Shareholders:  

I will no longer be writing Berkshireâ€™s annual report or talking endlessly at the annual meeting. As the British would say, Iâ€™m â€œgoing quiet.â€ 

Sort of. 

Greg Abel will become the boss at yearend. He is a great manager, a tireless worker and an honest communicator. Wish him an extended tenure. 

I will continue talking to you and my children about Berkshire via my annual Thanksgiving message. Berkshireâ€™s individual shareholders are a very special group who are unusually generous in sharing their gains with others less fortunate. I enjoy the chance to keep in touch with you. Indulge me this year as I first reminisce a bit. After that, I will discuss the plans for distribution of my Berkshire shares. Finally, I will offer a few business and personal observations. 

* * * * * * * * * * * * 

As Thanksgiving approaches, Iâ€™m grateful and surprised by my luck in being alive at 95. When I was young, this outcome did not look like a good bet. Early on, I nearly died.  

It was 1938 and Omaha hospitals were then thought of by its citizens as either Catholic or Protestant, a classification that seemed natural at the time.  

Our family doctor, Harley Hotz, was a friendly Catholic who made house calls toting a black bag. Dr. Hotz called me Skipper and never charged much for his visits. When I experienced a bad bellyache in 1938, Dr. Hotz came by and, after probing a bit, told me I would be OK in the morning.   

He then went home, had dinner and played a little bridge. Dr. Hotz couldnâ€™t, however, get my somewhat peculiar symptoms out of his mind and later that night he dispatched me to St. Catherineâ€™s Hospital for an emergency appendectomy. During the next three weeks, I felt like I was in a nunnery, and began enjoying my new â€œpodium.â€ I liked to talk â€“ yes, even then â€“ and the nuns embraced me. 

To top things off, Miss Madsen, my third-grade teacher, told my 30 classmates to each write me a letter. I probably threw away the letters from the boys but read and reread those from the girls; hospitalization had its rewards.  

The highlight of my recovery â€“ which actually was dicey for much of the first week â€“ was a gift from my wonderful Aunt Edie. She brought me a very professional-looking fingerprinting set, and I promptly fingerprinted all of my attending nuns. (I was probably the first Protestant kid they had seen at St. Catherineâ€™s and they didnâ€™t know what to expect.) 

My theory â€“ totally nutty, of course â€“ was that someday a nun would go bad and the FBI would find that they had neglected to fingerprint nuns. The FBI and its director, J. Edgar Hoover, had become revered by Americans in the 1930s, and I envisioned Mr. Hoover, himself, coming to Omaha to inspect my invaluable collection. I further fantasized that J. Edgar and I would quickly identify and apprehend the wayward nun. National fame seemed certain. 

Obviously, my fantasy never materialized. But, ironically, some years later it became clear that I should have fingerprinted J. Edgar himself as he became disgraced for misusing his post.  

Well, that was Omaha in the 1930s, when a sled, a bicycle, a baseball glove and an electric train were coveted by me and my friends. Letâ€™s look at a few other kids from that era, who grew up very nearby and greatly influenced my life but of whom I was for long unaware. 

Iâ€™ll begin with Charlie Munger, my best pal for 64 years. In the 1930s, Charlie lived a block away from the house I have owned and occupied since 1958. 

Early on, I missed befriending Charlie by a whisker. Charlie, 6 â…” years older than I, worked in the summer of 1940 at my grandfatherâ€™s grocery store, earning $2 for a 10-hour day. (Thrift runs deep in Buffett blood.) The following year I â€¦
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/0ltAir8_Fg7BAaoxk4p9QffMxzU7-uYuWeUbsCVhTeE/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5aVL-dWsAAaC9y.jpg

soâ€¦how are we feeling about this bifurcated economy argument that weâ€™ve all heard over the past year? 

stocks up, asset holders can continue to spend and subsidize the economy

ai capex up, the hyperscalers continue to keep the ai trade alive

on the other endâ€¦

low end consumer spending down, as seen via major consumer brands like $CMG and $LULU getting hit

subprime auto defaults hitting record highs, credit card debt continuing to climb at an aggressive pace

grocery / electricity prices continue to climbâ€¦ironically the ai capex trade is what could be causing electricity to be going up

do we think the Fed cutting rates can fix this? are layoffs only going to intensify because of AI which would be deflationary but hurt earnings?

many questions as we prepare for next yearâ€¦curious to hear an anecdotal experiences on how folks are thinking of the broader economy

$PLTR 

Tom Lee on Palantir's valuation:  

"I think Palantir is an example of what they call an n=1 business developing products that really seem like magic for the companies that use them. Palantir is opening up so many markets that if they were a venture capital firm they'd be getting carry for how they transform businesses. To me, I think this is still a market discovering how to define the valuation model for Palantir but that doesn't mean its a bubble, people would've said that about Tesla in 2018 since it looked incredibly expensive and Tesla has been a huge performer since then."

[11/11/2025 3:03] Mike â€¢ TweetShift

{Embed}
Mike (@MikeLongTerm) âœ§
https://twitter.com/MikeLongTerm/status/1988049838944985431
$HIMS Institutional onwership is now 105.62% ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£

[@â€‹wearehims](<https://twitter.com/wearehims>)  Short sellers are shorting the stock so much that now Institutional ownerships passed 105%

The reason:Institutions that are shorting the stock (betting on a price decline) must borrow shares from long holders to sell. This creates "overlapped" or "double-counted" shares in the total long reported shares. Short sellers report their shorts separately (, via 13F short disclosures), but the ownership percentage typically focuses on longs, inflating the total beyond the actual float (publicly available shares).

Total shares outstanding are approximately 219.7 million (inferred from the data: 231.6M long shares Ã· 105.62% â‰ˆ 219.2M, aligning with recent reports). The excess (5.62%) stems from these overlaps, not errors. High short interest amplifies this HIMS has had notable short activity in the past, though exact current short interest isn't detailed on the page.

This is common for high short interest stocks.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/ucrlxs2mFaShvn5oxY3O37T_7Y-oOxcgY8XBwLP6WR0/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5b4n4YXsAEMNXC.png
TweetShift â€¢ ğŸ“·1

$TSLA | Tesla prepares to expand Giga Texas with new Optimus production plant

Tesla is planning a major expansion of Gigafactory Texas with a new facility dedicated to manufacturing its Optimus humanoid robot, sources told Reuters. While some units are already being produced on a pilot line at the Fremont Factory in Northern California, Tesla intends to make the vast majority of Optimus units in Texas. 

CEO Elon Musk said the company will build one million units per year in Fremont but aims to produce 10 million units annually at the new Texas facility.

Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§

UBS Upgrades $LIN to Buy from Neutral, Lowers PT to $500 from $507

Analyst comments:
"We upgrade Linde to Buy as we believe the stock is at an attractive 2.5x up/downside skew, and we think an acceleration in EPS growth in 2026 will be a positive catalyst. LIN is currently trading at ~10% discount to average, consistent with where the stock has been when investors have shown lower confidence in growth. We think there are factors in 2025, that will not repeat in 2026, that will raise adj EPS growth from ~6% to ~9-10% YY. Then more backlog start-ups over 2026-27 helps by another 1-2%. There has also been more debate on the ability to maintain higher pricing, but we don't see that decelerating medium term. Overall we model adj EPS growth of ~9% in 2026 with no macro growth, and see adj EPS accelerating to ~11% CAGR in our medium term forecast. We think the stock is pricing in closer to a ~7% CAGR using our reverse DCF."

Analyst: Joshua Spector

Morgan Stanley on $CRWV (EW, $99 PT):

"Bottom line, accruing and expanding large contracts from the most demanding GenAI users provide strong validation of CoreWeave's strong positioning for the ramping GPU build-out, but consistent execution to provisioning and the operating of that GPU infrastructure â€“ even in a constrained environment â€“ will be key to proving durability in the story." 

"Being the premier provider of GPU clusters in an environment of swiftly ramping demand for GPU capacity is an unequivocal positive, and the company is making significant strides in diversifying the customer base â€“ with the Nvidia and Meta deal, now no customer represents >35% of revenue backlog." 

"However, the degree of difficulty in the high-wire act CoreWeave is performing has always been high, and likely getting higher in this environment. While we remain on the sidelines awaiting further evidence of the broadening of the software story at CoreWeave, for investors with strong conviction in the build-out of the GPU economy and longer-term investment horizons, a pullback in CRWV, better balancing the risk/reward, could be looked at as an interesting entry point."

Analyst: Keith Weiss

[11/11/2025 12:04] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1988185945854931431)

{Embed}
Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§
https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1988185945854931431
BTIG Raises $REAL PT to $15 from $11 - Buy

Analyst comments:
"REAL delivered resounding 3Q25 results, hitting the 20% growth barrier in a tough consumer environment. In the process, REAL delivered the largest GMV beat since the pandemic and, unlike back then, growth is coming at positive incremental EBITDA margins, highlighting the stark improvement in the business model in the past year from the leadership of the current management team.

Underlying KPIs also impressed with active buyers increasing by 23K q/q, the largest sequential increase since 4Q22. AOV increased 12% y/y, with both units and ASP contributing about equally to the increase. AOV growth accelerated sequentially compared to 8% y/y growth in 2Q25. Orders rose 7% y/y, 50 bps faster than buyer growth, leading to a modest improvement in orders per buyer. However, at 0.8 orders per buyer in the quarter, this metric is still 22% below pre-pandemic levels, suggesting there's significant future potential as newer cohorts mature (improved macro conditions wouldn't hurt either).

On the supply side, REAL's initiatives are also bearing fruit as supply value per luxury consultant rose 12% y/y. On the back of these strong results we are raising our PT on REAL shares to $15 from $11. In addition to being ideally positioned for the current environment and the aforementioned opportunity to grow orders/buyer, we see future catalysts including: 1) buying back the relatively expensive 13.00% 2031 Notes which become redeemable at par starting in October 2026; 2) further adoption of Athena which we expect to deliver $15MM+ in cost savings at full implementation; and 3) long-term opportunity to hit 40%+ incremental EBITDA margins through a combination of operating leverage opportunities, tariff-related pricing gains, and product mix.

This would drive meaningful upside to the low-30s incremental margins we are modeling through 2027. Our PT implies 3x 2027E sales and 4x 2027E gross profit, both in line with resale peer ThredUp (TDUP, Not Rated), which is more than justified in our view given REAL is growing ~200 bps faster than TDUP in terms of revenue with triple the EBITDA margins (based on each company's respective 4Q25 guidance). Maintain BUY."

Analyst: Marvin Fong
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/u0vQHd1Dfyk7FWGiFRcRXqirSzY2WHkB2-Uo8fFxbHo/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5d0kmNbAAAX0MZ.jpg

JPMorgan Downgrades $CRWV to Neutral from Overweight, Lowers PT to $110 from $135

Analyst comments:
"We continue to see tremendous long-term opportunity for CoreWeave to serve the AI mega-trend and appreciate the accolades it has achieved with momentum it is carrying through the combination of large slugs of business and a growing list of customers. More tactically, in our view, its FQ3 (September) results include both positive and negative developments, while the interpretation of the net takeaway may skew slightly in either direction, depending on investorsâ€™ relative focus on bookings versus revenue timing.

On the positive side of the ledger: revenue backlog nearly doubles sequentially and crosses well into the $50B range; the composition of the revenue backlog shows better diversification among the largest constituents; the company is adding customers such as CrowdStrike, Poolside, Rakuten, and Jasper to its roster; and the sovereign opportunity is becoming more visible with the launch of CoreWeave Federal and the addition of customers such as NASA and the UK government.

On the negative side: the new variable is supply chain pressures escalating to a point that they are impacting one specific third-party data center developer used by CoreWeave, which is running behind schedule and shifts some of CoreWeaveâ€™s revenue out of Q4. This means that not only are the major hyperscalers being forced to issue capacity-constrained revenue guidance, but the phenomenon is also spreading to CoreWeave, which has historically set one of the highest bars for orchestration and delivery timelines in deployment of modern AI data centers."

Analyst: Mark Murphy

Cantor Fitzgerald Raises $RKLB PT to $72 from $54 - OW 

Analyst comments:
"In our view, Rocket lab Neutron launch vehicle (once operational) will be the only current viable alternative to the Falcon 9, and will provide customers an opportunity to diversify away from SpaceX. In conclusion, we continue to view Rocket Lab's track record of successful space launches (heritage is a key differentiator), the portfolio of three different rocket types (small, hypersonic and medium launch), the customer type diversification (Commercial and Government / domestic and international), and the dedicated launchpads in New Zealand and the U.S., as material moats, and we remain bullish ahead of key material catalysts. We Reiterate our OW Rating and Increase our PT to $72 (from prior $54)."

Analyst: Andres Sheppard

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: $OKLO DOE approves Oklo nuclear fuel fabrication facility safety design

Oklo Inc. received approval from the U.S. Department of Energy's Idaho Operations Office for the Nuclear Safety Design Agreement for its Aurora Fuel Fabrication Facility at Idaho National Laboratory. The approval represents the first under the DOE's Fuel Line Pilot Projects program and was completed in under two weeks.

The facility will fabricate fuel for Oklo's Aurora-INL reactor, which was selected for the DOE's Reactor Pilot Program. Both facilities are located at Idaho National Laboratory and are designed to couple fuel production with power delivery for commercial deployment of advanced nuclear energy technology.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/sedJ4PqnHkSmRQOGwEhHem0VOHnGR1b0jMqJIH4A5W4/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5eeP91bcAc61VM.jpg

A BIG DATA CENTER PLANNED IN SOUTH KOREA COULD BE BUILT AND RUN BY AI

A $35 billion facility under development in South Korea ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· could be the worldâ€™s first large-scale data center designed, built and run by artificial intelligence.

The investor group behind the project, Stock Farm Road, has partnered with AI developer Voltai to make AI the architect, manager and operator of the South Korea-based data center. 

Under the partnership, dubbed â€œProject Concord,â€ AI will take charge of the data centerâ€™s design, construction and operation, from efficiently managing the use of resources like power and water to adapting quickly to different AI computing workloads. 

Humans will be involved, but only as supervisors, with AI acting as the decision-maker, the firms said.

(Source WSJ)
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/4Y6oMHn2yfv0OgYzHnEjrBrYpYo_JwNGWXos_-CnNRw/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5e6nn2XYAA-iYG.jpg

[11/11/2025 19:36] amit â€¢ TweetShift
[Tweeted](https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1988299645747925365)

{Embed}
amit (@amitisinvesting) âœ§
https://twitter.com/amitisinvesting/status/1988299645747925365
$GRAB

Very important updates over the past few days:

If you've been following the Grab-GoTo saga, earlier in the year many reports claimed that Grab would be making a bid for GoTo, their largest competitor in Indonesia. After a few months, those rumors died out.

Over the past week, state officials from the Indonesian President's office explicitly said they are looking for a way to merge Grab and GoTo as they believe the level of employment is critical to the region. 

The biggest issue has been a price war leading to good prices for consumers but bad margins for shareholders and bad wage for drivers. If you were to merge both, those issues would be resolved and you'd have much more stability.

This also comes after a horrific GoTo scandal where executives were syphoning money away from the state and putting in their pockets when it was supposed to go to under-served children in the region. This brand damage has not gone well with people in the region and regulators have also been very upset about this.

Well, late last night, Bloomberg reported that SoftBank (which owns a decent chunk of Grab and GoTo) is looking to potentially oust the GoTo CEO in order to clear the way for...a Grab takeover. 

"Several GoTo shareholders signed a memo to the board requesting an extraordinary general meeting, people familiar with the matter said, asking not to be identified as the move isnâ€™t public. The backers, which include some of GoToâ€™s co-founders, are proposing a vote on matters including replacing the CEO, who oversaw a more than 40% decline in GoToâ€™s market value over his tenure. Walujo is also perceived as opposing a takeover by Grab, the people said."

Basically, the CEO doesn't want a merger but isn't delivering shareholder returns. Grab has begun to really show growth in the region and their stock is up 35% over the past year, GoTo is down 1% over the same time. Softbank would likely want to consolidate their stakes so that there is one winner vs having two fight to win. The company in the better financial position is obviously Grab and actually has the cash (5.3B) to execute a merger, not sure what the price would be.

There is now an extraodinary general meeting for GoTo on December 17th. 

If this were to happen, it likely would be the ride-hailing/mobility part of GoTo merging and not the financial arm, but it would be absolutely massive.

My thesis on $GRAB has been that the regional players are consolidating and I feel Grab will be one of a few winners, getting access to everything GoTo has built an integrating it into their ecosystem could dramatically increase growth estimates and truly establish them as the dominant player. Smart money might also know this which is why 85% of the gloat is now owned by tutes.

Exciting story to cover as we head into 2026!

By the way, latest PT upgrades:

DBS --> $7.55
Barclays --> $7
Morgan Stanley --> $6.95
Phillip Securities --> $7
Benchmark --> $7
Evercore --> $8
Mizuho --> $7
Citi --> $7
Jeffries --> $6.80
JP Morgan --> $7.20
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/ClLBhpNzvGqniW_3M_2s6EeT49JooG1CVrg_-1Orz10/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5farCUXkAAitbY.jpg
TweetShift â€¢ ğŸ“·1

Morgan Stanley Upgrades $RXO to Overweight from Equalweight, PT $19 

Analyst comments: "We are upgrading RXO from EW to OW. Our PT remains $19, which implies ~65% upside to their stock price after the ~35% selloff post-earnings last week. The 4Q guide was undoubtedly disappointing pointing to near breakeven EPS, but 4Q guides have been weak across the space (average 11.5% downgrade) reflecting tough demand conditions to end the year. However, we remain confident that normalized EPS over time is at least $1 here, implying a ~$18â€“20 fair value at an 18â€“20x normalized PE multiple. The fact that RXO was an $18+ stock three weeks ago is a sign that once the Street is convinced that we are seeing some signs of market improvement, the stock should snap back as well, even if the post-Coyote $30+ highs will need evidence of $1.50+ normalized EPS over time. We also believe that RXO can be amongst the leaders in the deployment of AI in the brokerage space and that this will not be a winner-take-all space as the market is currently pricing into brokerage stocks (especially CHRW)."

Analyst: Ravi Shanker

UBS ran the math on the floated 50-year mortgage idea. On a median ~$420K home, it could lower monthly payments by about $119 (or boost bp by $23K)

But stretching the loan from 30-50 Yrs would roughly double the total interest paid & slow down how quickly homeowners build equity

$OKLO signed a new MOU with Idaho National Laboratory to expand work on advanced nuclear fuel and materials research. 

The Aurora-INL reactor, now under construction, will be used not just for power but to generate fast neutron data for fuel and materials testing. 

The goal is to accelerate U.S. fast reactor and fuel manufacturing capabilities.

JPMorgan Initiates Coverage on $RACE with Overweight Rating

Analyst comments: "Reflecting on the key takeaways from the Capital Markets Day and 3Q results, we had the opportunity to gain additional insights from the CEO during the earnings call. For us, a few elements stand out when looking at Ferrari:

a) The business model is robust, and upcoming product launches will continue to provide opportunities to improve pricing and mix, as well as potentially achieve the 2030 targets earlier than planned, possibly one or two years earlier.

b) The firm is going through a profound change in the powertrain strategy, which may create some margin volatility in 2026 as it will incur launch costs and higher costs for the ramp-up of the paintshop and E facility.

c) From the CMD, we came out convinced the firm is launching the necessary transition into BEV at the right time and has done a solid job ensuring vertical integration in some of the E components to continue to excite Ferrari customers.

Having said this, we believe buy-side expectations may be too high. Based on our discussions, the market expects high single-digit revenue growth supported by a pricing strategy that may not necessarily need to be backed by increased value add or technology content, as well as flawless execution with EBIT margins consistently above 30%. On the back of a potentially higher fixed cost burden in the next two years, we trim our FY26/27 earnings estimates by 6% and see the firm generating solid 29% EBIT margins on average over the next two years."

Analyst: Jose Asumendi

Raymond James Downgrades $BBWI to Market Perform from Outperform

Analyst comments: "While we believe there is low-hanging fruit to improve digital capabilities, product, and distribution, we expect this will take time to materialize, and until then, growth will remain below long-term potential. Our channel checks over the last two months suggest recent innovations have fallen short, while discounting in stores and online has increased (see table in note). We are lowering our estimates for both sales and EPS, and given our expectation for downward revisions to consensus, we believe risk/reward is now balanced even with shares trading at 8x EV/EBITDA and 10x P/E on CY26 estimates."

Analyst: Olivia Tong

We maintain that Okloâ€™s vertically integrated model remains a key differentiator â€” execution continues to outpace peers, and DOE alignment adds credibility â€” but valuation already embeds a relatively smooth FOAK-to-NOAK trajectory.

UBS ON $AMD EVENT:

"AMD's new financial model delivered on the $20+ EPS bogey that we and many investors expected, and equally importantly the near-term commentary on data center GPU also generally supports our ~$10 EPS for C2027E. Customer commentary was also constructive with AMD again affirming that there will be multiple customers at a similar scale to OpenAI as soon as the MI450 generation in 2H26/1H27." 

"We do worry a bit that HBM supply could be a risk for AMD and now that this event is out of the way, the only remaining near-term catalyst is an announcement by Amazon at AWS re:Invent in early Dec. Broadly though, if the company does even a decent fraction of what is laid out today, the stock should keep moving higher over the next 12mos." 

"Net, our C2026/2027E EPS remains largely unchanged, but given the multi-year confidence, we are walking C2028E EPS higher (up to ~$14 from ~$12 prior). 

Our PT uses C2027E as a basis and remains $300, and we continue to rate AMD Buy as a rapidly rising tide should continue to lift this boat."

$IBM unveiled its most advanced quantum processor, called Quantum Nighthawk, designed to deliver circuits with 30% more complexity and reach verified quantum advantage by 2026. 

The chip has 120 qubits and 218 couplers and will be available to users by late 2025. IBM also revealed Quantum Loon, a new experimental processor that brings together all key elements needed for fault-tolerant quantum computing, targeting 2029. 

The company has doubled development speed with a shift to 300mm wafer fabrication and aims to power AI and scientific workloads with more accurate, scalable quantum systems.

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: Bimergen Energy partners with $EOSE Eos Energy for battery storage projects

Bimergen Energy Corporation announced a Joint Development Agreement with Eos Energy Enterprises Inc. to accelerate battery storage projects across the United States.

The partnership combines Bimergen's project development capabilities with Eos' zinc-based battery technology for long-duration energy storage applications. Under the agreement, both companies will collaborate on project design, procurement and financing strategies.

The initial focus involves several late-stage ERCOT projects totaling 1.0 GWh that are currently being prepared for project financing. Eos will also support Bimergen in securing additional development capital for its broader portfolio.

Toyota $TM has started production at its $13.9B battery plant in Liberty, North Carolina, its first outside Japan. 

The 1,850-acre facility will employ about 5,100 people and produce up to 30 GWh of lithium-ion batteries a year for hybrid and electric models like the Camry HEV and RAV4 HEV. 

Toyota also plans to invest another $10B in the U.S. over the next five years, bringing its total U.S. investment to nearly $60B.

$NBIS $CRWV $IREN $ORCL

The street is obviously concerned about the datacenter trade.

Whatâ€™s the easiest way to tell?

Oracle was at $230 before their monster Q2 with RPO +450%. They went to $350 in less than 24 hours.

The stock is now below $230. What changed?

They issued $40B of corporate bonds, some of those bonds that got downgraded, and basically told the street they donâ€™t care about FCF because the ROI on capex growth matters more.

Now, I am actually happy to see $ORCL come back to reality. The move it made really was pure fomo, but if the street is scared about a psudeo-hyperscaler and their debit issuances, obviously they arenâ€™t going to be happy with Nebius dilution, CoreWeave debt-equity ratio, or the unit economics on some of these BTC miners turned AI/HPC players. 

Is that full on bearish? No, but it is, in my opinion, VERY HEALTHY because many of those names are up 2-3x on the year, even with this recent drop!

I think you pick the best one and DCA, but you wait for core levels. I mean if Nebius gets back to $70â€¦itâ€™s almost like the entire $MSFT deal is erased. Itâ€™d be VERY attractive at those levels. I nibbled just now as a relatively new shareholder at $93.90 but I would be more interested if it really breaks down â€” which it may not, but the debt concerns seem to be the issue.

Exceptional execution, which many of those names have done, is what makes the dips buy-able if you believe in the broader macro AI datacenter trend as outlined by Lisa Su yesterday to further reinforce how large the market is becoming, but the debt concerns seem to be why these stocks are getting hit.

As it relates to tariff exemptions, Bessent mentioned that â€œyou're going to see some substantial announcements over the next couple of days in terms of things we don't grow here in the United States, coffee being one of them, bananas, other fruits, things like that. So that will bring the prices down very quickly.â€ 

Companies within our coverage involved in cross-border sourcing for these types of raw materials include $KDP, $SJM, and $KHC for coffee, and $DOLE for bananas, and $COCO for other fruits (coconuts). 

This is not the first time the potential for tariff exemptions on internationally sourced raw materials has been discussed. In July, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, also mentioned potential exemptions for the raw materials above as well as cocoa $HSY. We see potential for spices (e.g. vanilla, cinnamon) to be another exemption as a result $MKC."

SOME IMPORTANT MACRO STATS TO LOOK AT:

1. Bank of America says institutional clients were net buyers of U.S. equities last week, led by $4.3 billion in ETF inflows, largest since December 2022.

2. Hedgefunds and Retail were actually net sellers, institutional investors were net buyers. Outflows from Tech and inflows into Staples and Healthcare.

3. As per Bloomberg, ETF inflows continue to be strong, +13B yesterday alone, +40B for the past 5 days and now +1.16T YTD.

While there are plenty of concerns around inflation and the labor market, equity exposure continues to be strong even if there is a rotation into different sectors, which is actually very healthy to see to support the broadening of the market.

Federal workers will get back pay, agencies will start clearing the backlog, and food assistance should come back online over the next week as states reload their systems.

Alibaba $BABA is planning a full revamp of its main mobile AI app, Bloomberg reports. The company will update its existing Tongyi apps and rebrand them as Qwen, then start adding agent style tools that can help users shop across Taobao and other services. 

The longer term goal is for Qwen to function as a full AI agent, with an overseas version planned later on. 

More than 100 developers are working on the project as Alibaba looks to match competitors like ByteDance and Tencent and eventually build a consumer revenue stream from AI.

The IEA has lifted its global oil demand outlook, but it still expects supply to pull ahead. 

The agency now sees demand rising 790k barrels a day in 2025 and 770k in 2026, both slightly higher than before. 

Yet supply is expected to grow even faster, with a projected surplus of about 4.09 million barrels a day in 2026, up from its earlier estimate of 3.97 million.

Goldman Sachs Maintains Buy on $ASND, PT $250

Analyst comments: "Yorvipath misses amidst heightened expectations; awaiting regulatory decisions on TransCon CNP, which could become the third leg of growth. ASND shares are under pressure (down -7% in the after-market) after the company reported its 3Q25 results with Yorvipath sales of â‚¬143mn coming in short of VA consensus estimates of about â‚¬149mn though largely in-line with GSe of $144mn. We view the slight miss as largely reflecting transient issues (namely inventory and FX) rather than changes in market demand or dynamics. On the forward, we think investors will monitor: 1) upcoming PDUFA for TransCon CNP in achondroplasia, 2) the cadence of the Yorvipath launch in both the US and EU, 3) 52-week data from the Phase 2 COACH TransCon CNP + GH combination study (early 2026), 4) competitor updates in achondroplasia and hypoparathyroidism, and 5) the company's transition to consistent operating income and positive earnings. Maintain Buy and our 12-month PT of $250."

Analyst: Paul Choi

Goldman Sachs Maintains Early-Stage Biotech Rating on $PRME

Analyst comments: "PRME hosted an investor event outlining its strategy in Wilson's disease, in the context of preclinical data of prime editor PM577 at the American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases (AASLD) meeting (November 7â€“11) and the unmet need, with high rates of non-adherence to standard-of-care (30%â€“50% per the hosted KOL). PRME presented mouse model data, highlighting: (1) >80% correction of the H1069Q mutation with PM577 treatment, noting several prime editor candidates capable of >70% R778L correction (cumulative mutation prevalence of 50%); (2) restoration of copper homeostasis in the liver per copper PET imaging, returning to wild-type levels by week 8 following a single administration of PM577; and (3) no detectable off-target editing â€” identified by management as a key differentiator vs. other genome editing approaches. PRME remains on track to file the IND/CTA in Wilson's disease in 1H26, with H1069Q as the targeted mutation followed by R778L, and initiate a Ph1/2 study (data in 2027) assessing safety and PM577's ability to maintain copper balance post-discontinuation of standard-of-care. Overall, we view PRME's forward strategy as logical, leveraging the modularity of its platform and proprietary LNP to expand to other Wilson's mutations (potentially under the same IND) and liver indications (IND/CTA for PM647 in alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency expected in mid-26)."

Analyst: Salveen Richter

[13/11/2025 12:45] Wall St Engine â€¢ TweetShift

Wall St Engine (@wallstengine) âœ§
https://twitter.com/wallstengine/status/1988920994610966776
Wells Fargo Upgrades $NKE to Overweight from Equal Weight, Raises PT to $75 from $60; 'Visibility Now Improving, Lacing Up for Liftoff'

Analyst comments: "Raising Ests, Upside Scenarios Are Compelling. We raise our FY26 (above St) to $1.70 and FY27 to $2.40, but more notably, through a combo of our 1) Upside rev drivers (Classics stability + non-Classics biz growth) and 2) Ample GM recapture (ASPs + liquidation/reserve add backs) we show line of sight to Bull Case EPS Power of ~$2.00 and ~$3.00 over the same time periods. Said differently, NKE has been in a negative revision cycle for 3+ years, and we see that reversing over the next 6 to 9 months.

Why Upgrade Now? We believe for the first time in years a few things are happening: 1) Visibility is improving into NKE's revamped strategies (numbers bottoming), 2) Material green shoots are appearing (innovation) and 3) Headwinds to the biz are set to dissipate (Classics). We can finally begin to map out realistic return to growth forecasts, while sizable margin levers likewise take hold. Said differently, NKE has the potential to exit FY26 growing revs +3 to 4 percent with GMs expanding +200bps.

Classics Headwinds Have Peaked. We model Classics revs to decline to ~$9B in FY26 (from ~$11.5B in FY25). Classics headwind to rev peaked in 4Q (down >30 percent) and was likely down ~30 percent in 1Q. From here, 3 things inform our view that moderation is set to play out go forward: 1) industry checks confirm this view, 2) NKE commented they are seeing stabilization in AF1/AJ1, 3) historical sneaker search data tells us large franchise downtrends can last 40 to 70 months (with AF1/AJ1 currently at 63 and 54 months).

Non-Classics Back to Growth. A key today is the health of NKE's go forward business, and our math suggests that both footwear (ex Classics) and NKE's rest of biz accelerated meaningfully in 1Q. Non-Classics Footwear inflected to >20 percent while rest of biz was +MSD (led by apparel). While wholesale sell in surely accounts for a chunk of this growth, it is also clear that NKE's revamped silhouettes (Vomero and Peg) are driving greater volumes and should lend credibility to the turnaround efforts.

GM Visibility Is High. While GM remained in decline in 1Q, we see several key drivers which should lead to material GM recapture starting in 2H26. Namely, 1) NA liquidation laps, 2) improved ASPs/FP selling on Nike Direct and 3) potential recapture of reserves. These should all act as tailwinds to GM from 2H26 through FY27 (with a China GM recapture story looming in FY27).

Netting this all out, we see potential for NKE to drive upside to St GMs for the remainder of the FY in the 50 to 100bps range."

Analyst: Ike Boruchow

BofA Securities Upgrades $TT to Buy from Neutral, Raises PT to $550 from $490

Analyst comments: "We upgrade our rating on Trane Technologies (TT) to Buy from Neutral: (1) Trane has executed well through the resi slowdown in 2H25 and should get the potential upside in 2026; (2) Trane should benefit from Americas Transport recovery in 2026; (3) Trane benefits from strong exposure to applied HVAC, ~22% of revenue; (4) Traneâ€™s growing service business dampens its cyclicality. We raise our PO by 12% to $550 still on 24x EV/EBITDA, but now based on 2027E from 2026E. We estimate that applied HVAC equipment represents ~22% of Traneâ€™s revenue and services represent 1/3 of revenue. Traneâ€™s applied business has remained strong, with CHVAC booking and sales up in all three regions in 3Q. Despite tough comps Traneâ€™s Americas CHVAC business had orders up ~30%. For applied, Trane has seen particular strength in data centers as well as education, government, and health care. Trane expects strong execution and growth to continue in 2026. Despite potential cyclicality related to lumpiness of large orders and resi weakness, Trane has been able to consistently execute as the service business helps offset the cyclicality. With help from the service business Trane has outperformed its HVAC peers and Street expectations."

Analyst: Andrew Obin

ğŸ“¢ ğ‰ğ”ğ’ğ“ ğˆğ: Joby completes first flight of hybrid turbine electric aircraft - $JOBY $LHX 

Joby Aviation Inc. announced its turbine electric autonomous aircraft completed its first flight on November 7 at the company's Marina, California facility. The demonstrator aircraft integrates a hybrid turbine powertrain with Joby's electric air taxi platform and SuperPilot autonomy technology.

The flight occurred three months after Joby announced the aircraft concept and formed a partnership with L3Harris Technologies. L3Harris plans to equip Joby's commercial hybrid aircraft for defense applications including contested logistics and autonomous operations.

Verizon $VZ is planning to cut about 15,000 jobs or 15% of its workforce

The cuts, the largest ever for the carrier, are set to take place in the next week. The majority of the reduction is expected to be made through layoffs

Verizon also plans to transition about 200 stores into franchised operations, which will shift employees off of its payroll.

Verizon had about 100,000 employees as of February

- Verizon just announced 15K layoffs, 15% of their workforceâ€¦markets seem to be thinking they can not ignore labor market even without data

- 3 different fed presidents all came out over the past 48 hours and said they are more concerned about inflationâ€¦Powell a few weeks ago made it clear he cares more about the downside risk to the labor market, so the sudden shift is now making people think a december cut wont happen

along with the potential fears on ai capex spend, that seems to be causing this drawdown

having said thatâ€¦

- earnings are strong 

- tutes are buying heavily

- margins continue to increase

- datacenter buildout isnt going anywhere even if some debt is involved

- $AMD just guided for 35% rev growth next 5 years, $NVDA earnings next week

- rates eventually coming down and companies are still executing very well so money likely will be allocated as we prepare for cuts

- if the supreme court does reverse tariffs, could be bullish since markets never liked tariffs and could lower inflation expectations

not enough to go net bearish here and the lack of a real headline causing this pain means it might just be a headfake

**NEW RETIREMENT ACCOUNT CONTRIBUTION LIMITS FOR 2026 WERE JUST ANNOUNCED**

 - Workers will be able to put up to $24,500 into their 401(k)s and similar workplace retirement accounts in 2026, up $1,000 from this year

- For IRAs, the maximum contribution will rise to $7,500 in 2026, from $7,000.

Limits on 401(k) and IRA contributions are higher for older workers.

- For 401(k)s, people 50 and older will be able to contribute an extra $8,000 in 2026, for a total of $32,500. Those ages 60 to 63 will be able to contribute even more, for a total of $35,750.

- For IRAs, those 50 and older will be able to contribute an extra $1,100. The IRA catch-up contributionâ€”long $1,000â€”is now being adjusted for inflation under a provision of a 2022 law.

(Source WSJ)
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/kdYPeFUo3HSiun01HOHLxkRJoHbdj6W4YX-LUZgHGV8/https/pbs.twimg.com/media/G5qCWMKWQAALSIo.jpg

I was reading an FT piece on phantom data centers and utilities are finally cracking down. 

AEP Ohio has cut almost 30% of its queue and PG&E has dropped 400MW after realizing developers were pitching the same projects to multiple utilities. 

The chart shows how wide the 2030 energy forecasts swing from about 400TWh to over 1000TWh.

I was reading an FT piece about how â€œphantomâ€ data centers are throwing US power planning completely off, and itâ€™s honestly wild how big the disconnect has become. 

Developers are chasing the cheapest electricity, so theyâ€™re filing the same project with multiple utilities and then leaving those requests in the queue even after the plans are basically dead. 

Thatâ€™s forcing utilities to clean house, AEP Ohio has already cut close to 30% of its pending projects and PG&E is trimming another 400MW, because theyâ€™re realizing the demand projections are being inflated by stuff that will never get built. 

And when you look at the chart, you see why theyâ€™re worried. Forecasts for 2030 data center electricity use are swinging from roughly 400TWh to over 1000TWh, which is the kind of spread that leads to overbuilt plants and higher rates for everyone. 

The whole system is trying to figure out whatâ€™s real and what isnâ€™t.

Jefferies Upgrades $GAP to Buy from Hold, Raises PT to $30 from $22

Analyst comments: "The key takeaway is that we believe Gap has implemented fundamental changes that should drive improved near-term and long-term results. Year-over-year promotions are down and average selling prices are up at Gap. Old Navy and Gap rolling three-month web traffic turned positive quarter-over-quarter, with Old Navy foot traffic up 4%. Old Navy provides the strongest value, purchase consideration, and favorability in our group, while Banana Republic saw month-over-month improvement in purchase intent and favorability. We see an opportunity for Gap to reach $3.00 in earnings per share by fiscal year 2028. Our third-quarter earnings per share estimate is $0.62 versus the Street at $0.58."

Analyst: Corey Tarlowe

Baird Upgrades $CRCL to Outperform from Neutral, PT $110

Analyst comments: "Circle underperformed the S&P by 63% since the June 30, 2025 close (CRCL -55%; S&P +9%) as the lock-up expiration approached (and occurred on November 13), post-IPO optimism faded, and concerns rose around falling rates and increasing distribution costs. We view valuation as reasonable (approximately 50x 2026E EPS) given strong USDC outstanding growth (Q3 +92% year over year; Q2 +86%), a sequential doubling of on-Circle USDC (from which Circle retains 100% of reserve income), accelerating wallet growth (+77% year over year), and strong interest in Arc/CPN testing (with about 100 partners onboarded and more than 500 in the pipeline)."

Analyst: David Konig

Stifel Downgrades $HD to Hold from Buy, Lowers PT to $370 from $440

Analyst comments: "We outline a cautious bias toward Home Depot and Loweâ€™s fiscal third-quarter 2025 earnings and are reducing our Home Depot rating to Hold from Buy. We believe the home improvement category is at best stagnant and potentially deteriorating ahead of difficult November and December comparisons. While we continue to believe the structural drivers of the home improvement category remain intact, the near-term setup is too challenging to maintain our positive stance. We have reduced our Home Depot and Loweâ€™s second-half 2025, fiscal 2026, and fiscal 2027 estimates to reflect a weaker second half of 2025 and a delayed category recovery. We are now meaningfully below consensus for both companies, and we do not believe buyside expectations fully appreciate the magnitude of potential revisions. We believe Home Depotâ€™s fiscal third-quarter 2025 results and commentary will reveal weaker same-store sales performance relative to initial expectations, with the shortfall prompting scrutiny of Home Depotâ€™s Complex Pro efforts, where the company has spent more than $20 billion on mergers and acquisitions ahead of the December Investor Day."

Analyst: W. Andrew Carter

KeyBanc Earnings Preview of $NVDA (OW, $250 PT): 

"Expect Nvidia to report strong F3Q (Oct) results and guide F4Q (Jan) higher. We expect key drivers of upside to include: 1) Increasing shipments of B300, which should represent unit and ASP tailwinds; 2) Improving GB300 rack production, as we estimate FY26 rack shipments of 28K-30K; 3) Increasing Hopper production, which indicates NVDA may have resumed shipments to China. Conversely, we believe NVDA is capacity constrained, which could limit more meaningful upside and impact shipments of gaming GPUs. Accordingly, we're raising estimates slightly and reiterate our Overweight rating."

Telsey says Under Armour $UAA and Stephen Curry will split in 2026, with a 12 month wind down and the Curry 13 as the final shoe in February 2026, plus colorways and apparel running through October.

The Curry brand is expected to do about $100m to $120m in FY26, roughly 10% of UA footwear and 2% of total sales, so they do not see a big profit hit, but Curry has first rights on his signed athletes and could take them elsewhere, with Nike, Adidas, New Balance, Puma, Reebok, Anta and Li Ning all potential suitors.

Furner, 51, currently leads Walmart U.S., started as an hourly associate in 1993, and is joining the board immediately. McMillon will stay on the board through June and advise Furner through FY27.

JPMorgan Upgrades $MP to Overweight from Neutral, Lowers PT to $74 from $75

Analyst comments: "Following third-quarter results, we updated our MP model with Form 10-Q items and new accounting guidance for its landmark Department of Defense deal, including the $110 per kilogram neodymium-praseodymium price floor that took effect on October 1. Based on our revised estimates and mark-to-market pricing, we are upgrading the shares to Overweight with a slightly lower $74 price target for approximately 29% implied upside (versus the prior Neutral rating and $75 price target). Our new rating reflects our view that rare earths national security concerns are here to stay despite Chinaâ€™s reported one-year pause on export restrictions, with risks remainingâ€”especially for military exposure. MPâ€™s unique mine-to-magnet vertical integration positions the company as the ex-China leader ready to begin addressing these concerns immediately, though it will ultimately take multiple players many years to resolve them. Shares have come under pressure over the past month, falling 39% versus the S&P 500 and XME at +1% and â€“14%, respectively, and neodymium-praseodymium pricing at +2%, which we believe offers an attractive entry point."

Analyst: Bill Peterson

very ugly premarkets

3 reasons it seems like the wind is getting taken out:

- no data transparency from October
- crypto de-leveraging
- AI capex trade fears 

last Friday, we had the shutdown headline to reverse the pain

today, I donâ€™t know what headline reverses it unless the market simply thinks the selloff has become overdone

no one knows if that will happen or if the bottom continues to fall out, but margin calls/stop losses/forced liquidations all could contribute to a further hit until you have buyers and algos step in and begin buying 

important to just be liquid/solvent enough to last through a day like this if it does get worse

wild card is if Trump comes out and says something, only thing I can imagine is potentially more tariff reductions to ease prices but market may need more

US and UK companies have pulled back on FX hedging. 

A MillTech survey of 250 firms found average hedge ratios fell to 46% in Q3 from 57% in Q2, and average hedge length shortened to 5.8 months, even though over 90% of treasurers say they plan to increase hedge ratios next year and many still expect BoE and Fed rate hikes.

Wells Fargo Raises PT on $NVDA to $265 from $220 - Overweight

Analyst comments: "We slightly increase our near-term estimates, but more notably raise our fiscal year 2027 and fiscal year 2028 estimates given continued upside momentum in hyperscale capital expenditures. We now model fiscal year 2026, fiscal year 2027, and fiscal year 2028 at $209.2 billion / $4.61, $301.6 billion / $7.05, and $383.2 billion / $8.90, respectively (versus prior estimates of $208.9 billion / $4.60, $281.7 billion / $6.61, and $323.2 billion / $7.51). We increase our fiscal year 2026, fiscal year 2027, and fiscal year 2028 Data Center revenue estimates to $186.6 billion (+62% year over year), $276.4 billion (+48%), and $356.5 billion (+29%).

With our increased estimates and maintaining a consistent calendar year 2027 ~30x price-to-earnings multiple given NVIDIA's strong growth and best-in-class positioning for continued data center and artificial intelligence investments, we increase our price target to $265 (from $220). Our conversations suggest the upside calendar year 2027 earnings-per-share bogey has moved into the +$9 per share range (versus our current $8.90 estimate). NVIDIAâ€™s supply ramp and its confidence and visibility into continued demand strength through 2026 and beyond remain key focus areas."

Analyst: Aaron Rakers

U.S. dairy is putting about $11B into new processing plants across 19 states through 2028, but labor is the choke point. 

Farm labor is down ~7% since spring, immigrant workers make up roughly half the dairy workforce, and most year round jobs are shut out of H-2A. 

NMPF and IDFA warn that without visa reform a lot of this new capacity may end up underused.

BofA on $NVDA (Buy, PT $275): 

"NVIDIA is the only merchant chip supplier with proven full-stack, rack-scale execution in large artificial intelligence cluster, first with Blackwell (GB200), then with Blackwell Ultra (GB300), and next year with Vera Rubin (VR), giving it three generations of experience by the second half of calendar year 2026. 

Cloud capital expenditure concerns tend to be seasonal (highest in the fourth quarter) and typically resolve when the new year begins and cloud customers provide their capex outlooks. 

NVIDIAâ€™s valuation remains compelling at 27x and 21x price-to-earnings on our calendar year 2026 and calendar year 2027 estimates, essentially a market multiple for the leading franchise in the fastest global growth cycle, trading at roughly 0.6x calendar year 2027 price/earnings-to-growth versus the S&P 500 at about 2x. 

Our $275 price objective is now based on 30x calendar year 2027 estimates versus 44x calendar year 2026 estimates as we extend our model forward."

Analyst: Vivek Arya
